characters: A RATTLE OF MACHINE GUN FIRE
WITH ONE OF THE SECURITY MEN
TWO BORING VERTOL HEAVY LIFTING HELICOPTERS, (HLH)
AND HEAVE IT OFF THE APC
HOLY FUCK, THE GUY IN THE TREE
THE WALKIE, HE CAN HEAR THEM --
WHY ARE THEY IGNORING THE OTHER
BACK WHERE HE LEFT THE PREDATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backed by the glow of compu-screens, a half-glimpsed alie A PREDATOR -- watches the receding ARK through a viewport (NOTE: we see him mostly in shadow, full reveal to come).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency lights illuminate a dank, organic-looking interior. CAMERA MOVES PAST:

dialogues.speaker: EIGHT STASIS CYLINDERS
dialogues.text: Around the periphery. FROST clouds the cryotubes, prevent from seeing the “passengers.” Finally, CAMERA ARRIVES AT

dialogues.speaker: A HULKING, DREAD-LOCKED FIGURE
dialogues.text: The pilot of this crippled ship. We do not see him fully either, but for the record? This is our “GOOD” PREDATOR.” HIS TALONS dance across a control panel; a shrill beep..! Predator symbols, but we get the idea: ERROR--ERROR--ERRO Our Predator TAPS more controls. Feverish. Until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final tether COMES LOOSE, venting PLASMA energy, and --  Through the viewport, the Ark is enveloped by a BLINDING LIGHT -- then a SWIRL OF PARTICLE ENERGY, as we --

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: STARFIELD. Silence. Then -- THE ARK DROPS out of hyperspace. SHUDDERS into a NEW ORBI Approaching what is, in fact, A DYING PLANET. Ice caps melting; atmosphere toxified; the dominant species continually finding new ways to fuck things up. Oddly, the only planet in our solar system not named afte a God: Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPARKS, gagging smoke... Our Predator realizes he’s on a sinking ship... He programs a new command sequence;

dialogues.speaker: ON A MONITOR
dialogues.text: of the CRYOTUBES. A SCROLLING COUNTDOWN, commenced -- in Predator symbols. A self destruct sequence..? One last thing: The Predator taps the panel again -- and a SLOT OPENS, revealing A DEVICE like a Steampunk TV remote. This is the KUJHAD. Remember it. He extracts it from its slot and -- K-CHK! SNAPS IT into own WRIST COMPUTER. Then he rises urgently, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ARK SHUDDERS, penetrating earth’s atmosphere, as: WHO AN ESCAPE POD, JETTISONED... From the main body of the craft. A series of RIPPLING SHIMMERS engulf it, and before our eyes, it auto-engages STEALTH CAMOUFLAGE -- and VANISHES. Pause. Then... a rising swell of JUNGLE NOISES... It begi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rugged face. Stubble. He’s looking down, eyes red-rimmed with fatigue, as we HEAR: A hollow TRICKLE of piss in plastic. He finishes. Screws the top back on a thermos. Then lower it, where it DANGLES ON A THIN NYLON LINE because we are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH THE SOLDIER, perched in a gnarled tree... THIRTY FEE OFF THE GROUND. He shifts in his “nest.” Brings to bear an M24 sniper rifle. Meet LIEUTENANT QUINN McKENNA, 30s. On the BACK of his hand... a faded (yet prominent) CRESCENT SCAR. Souvenir of another fight.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: WE HEAR a TALKIE SQUELCH -- then a tinny voice from his Bluetooth headset: HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE (filtered) Piggy One, copy. (beat) Piggy One, this is Piggy Two, do you copy? MCKENNA (into headset mike) I was peeing. Do you mind..? ANOTHER RADIO VOICE joins the conversation, filtered: DUPREE’ S TALKIE VOICE Piggy Three. I have a question, over.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Cut the chatter. He cracks his neck, then adjusts his scope. DUPREE’S TALKIE VOICE Seriously. If you’re the one that went to market, right? That means Haines and me, we get to choose between the roast beef and the staying home. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dupree, I swear to God -- McKenna presses his eye to the rifle sight.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH HIS SCOPE
dialogues.text: A MANSION. Neoclassical. Built in the 1850s, but painted hot Havana aquamarine. Surrounded by high walls and roaming SENTRIES. You guessed it: A DRUG LORD’S COMPOUND. DUPREE’S TALKIE VOICE I just wanna be the stay home piggy, that’s all I’m saying. HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE McKenna. We got a problem. McKenna tenses.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What is it? HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE You can’t be the one who went to market. You already went wee wee wee. McKenna shakes his head; he’s so over these assholes. He wipes away sweat, SWIVELS the rifle, SEEING:

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL CONVOY, NOW
dialogues.text: On the DIRT ROAD leading into the compound. BLACK SUVs.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (all business) Eyes north. HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE I see it.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Stay sharp. Ranging now. He presses his eye to the scope, PANNING WITH: THE SUVs As they stop, dust rising. DRUG SOLDIERS besiege the vehicles -- roughly PULLING OUT several HOSTAGES with pillow cases over their heads.  A MAN in a silk shirt appears. The DRUG LORD faces the sagging hostages, contemptuous. His men raise their weapo

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) (into com) Target in the reticle, no cross wind. I’m not waiting, 10-50 out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he slowly, silently, FLICKS the safety catch. He cente the Drug Lord’s head in the crosshairs. Stops breathing. All in all, a pretty crappy time for an EARTHQUAKE. A deep bass RUMBLE, coming from... where? Above? As, utterly without warning -- THE TOP OF THE DRUG LORD’S MANSION -- SHEARED OFF BEFORE OUR EYES. A TSUNAMI of debris, blown loose. EXPELLED -- Whatever caused it, it’s headed right AT MCKENNA. He DROPS the rifle; GRABS his combat knife to CUT HIMSELF LOOSE -- TUMBLES, as the canopy of green ERUPTS--! CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Amid sudden SILENCE. On his side now, face in the dirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing that the UFO just effectively PUNCHED A TUNNEL in the jungle, strewn with smoking debris and pulped branche He blinks. No telling how long he was out. A minute? An hour? He looks up, keys his headset: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Piggy Team, do you copy? In his ear, only STATIC. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Goddammit, COPY! Still: nothing but STATIC. McKenna stumbles to his feet. Feeling exposed. Trees, aflame. Smoke everywhere. Exhales raggedly, all too aware he’s squarely in

dialogues.speaker: THE DEBRIS FIELD
dialogues.text: left by the spacecraft. Only now, he’s SEEING:

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR EJECTION POD
dialogues.text: It lies hissing, spitting. Swamped in plant matter. He eases to a halt. Wary. Sights through

dialogues.speaker: HIS SCOPE
dialogues.text: And we notice, first off -- the HATCH. It’s open, steam curling from inside. He stalks forward, past the muddy, smoking IMPACT CRATER. Looks down. Frowns:

dialogues.speaker: DROPLETS OF FLUORESCENT FLUID
dialogues.text: On the ground. Lying amidst them, something we recognize: A Predator WRIST GAUNTLET. Discarded? Jarred loose? Beside it, he notices something else: a tiny metal DEVICE that resembles a trilobite. A CLOAKING BALL. McKenna stoops -- palms the alien-looking device... HEARS VOICES. He DIVES behind a fallen LOG. Snaps the rifle to his shoulder, sights downrange. 300 yards -- People are swarming out of the drug mansion. Fuck. He nervously juggles the metal BALL.... absently depresse a SWITCH (an electronic HUM) -- He looks left -- all clear. Glances over his shoulder. Looks to his RIGHT -- ohmyfuckingGod. Jumps a foot. A FUCKING PREDATOR. Two feet away -- and it wasn’t there a SECOND AGO. He scrambles backward, blinks: The PREDATOR, stock still. No reaction. Simply lies there, all eight feet of it. Its MASK askew. We realize: He’s been there ALL ALONG. McKenna merely DE-CLOAKED him. He holds his breath, cautious not to wake the sleeping beast. That said, he can’t resist. Licks his lips, reaches... cautiously LIFTS the dislodged BATTLE MASK worn by the Predator. Looks down, blanching - At the insectile craziness this thing calls a FACE.  MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Fuck me. He dry-washes his face with his hand. Scans the alien tec -- mask, gauntlet. Evidence. With quick, practiced moves, STASHES them in his pack -- MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Sorry, bud. Without these, no one’s gonna believe me. He starts to go, STOPS. Looks back, says softly: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Welcome to earth, brother. Just so you know..? (lights up) It only gets worse from here. He turns. RUNS... As he leaves frame, CAMERA settles on the hulking, sprawled PREDATOR -- Its EYES SNAP OPEN. EXT. JUNGLE - WITH McKENNA - DAY Moving through the overgrowth. Sudden CRACKLE of radio chatter: HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE (0.S.) Repeat: switch to 30-30, Dupree, do you copy? THEY'RE BACK ONLINE. Bingo. McKenna stops, keys his walki

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Piggy Two, respond, over. HAINES’ TALKIE VOICE McKenna, is that you? Now DUPREE’S voice joins in: DUPREE’ S TALKIE VOICE Hi, guys. Can I just say - - holy shit?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: We’re blown. Move out, converge for extraction. HAINES’ VOICE Copy that. I have visual on Dupree, I -- what the fuck..?  McKenna freezes.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Did not copy that. Talk to me, Haines. HAINES’ VOICE I... There’s something moving... (beat) Dupree, break left, break left--!

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Talk to me, what’s happening??

dialogues.speaker: A RATTLE OF MACHINE GUN FIRE
dialogues.text: A series of strangled HUMAN SCREAMS. HE DOESN’T NEED

dialogues.speaker: THE WALKIE, HE CAN HEAR THEM --
dialogues.text: McKenna CHARGES BACK in the direction he just came from. He SNAPS his rifle to his shoulder; TEARING through the brush. HEARTBEAT thudding in his ears... as: A NEW SOUND, NOW -- RISING. A low, bass THUMPING -- WHUP-WHUP-WHUP. He looks up, SEES

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Inbound, range 500 meters. What the hell? Skimming the treeline... on a bee-line for the Drug Lord’s compound. McKenna frowns: his extraction..? No. Impossible. Wrong helicopter. He heaves to his feet, switches on his mic: MCKENNA (INTO MIC) (CONT’D) Mayday. TIC in process. Bogey inbound. AH-6 Little Bird, BLACK, no markings. Who sent these gu-- The chopper UNLEASHES TWO AIR-TO-SURFACE ROCKETS. A sudden, sky-high whooosh... McKenna, AGAPE -- They come vectoring in, remorseless. DETONATE--! Say goodbye to the mansion. The sentries. The Drug Lord. And his Soldiers. AND the Hostages. All gone in one horrendous, volcanic SECOND -- Pretty much the job McKenna came here to do. Except no prisoners, no witnesses, no mercy.  Scorched. Fucking. Earth. The chopper BANKS sharply, coming in for a landing. BLACK CLAD MERCS, already leaning out the sides...

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Debris pelting down around him. Stumbling, gun up -- Bursts through a thicket into a clearing --

dialogues.speaker: BACK WHERE HE LEFT THE PREDATOR
dialogues.text: But no Predator. Just a sea of blood. THE REMAINS OF TWO SOLDIERS; dressed like McKenna. Same camo face paint, jungle khakis. His men. McKenna spins, gun tracking. Sights down the barrel:

dialogues.speaker: BLACK OPS MERCS
dialogues.text: From the helicopter. Headed his way. No way out. McKenna looks to his team; shredded. EVISCERA Draws a shuddering breath... BOLTS. Deeper into the jungle -- leaving them behind, as the scene, from everywhere and nowhere, a piercing SHRIEK An eerie PREDATOR WAR CRY, echoing... as we END SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic. Choking fumes. Blaring Afro-Cuban JAZZ. THREE CUBAN POLICE OFFICERS push through the locals. Flashing an 8x10 PHOTOGRAPH. Chattering urgently.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: An Air Force Lieutenant in dress blues. Handsome. Clean-shaven. MCKENNA. The COPS pass by an ALLEY, routinely peer inside -- Empty. DEAD END. Garbage cans, filth, dried urine. A CAT. No sign of McKenna. They move on. WE HOLD AS...  10. The brindled CAT begins to ripple. To distort.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS-LIKE HUMAN CONTOURS
dialogues.text: appear, against the surrounding stucco. A CRACKLE of energy, like TV static, AS -- A MAN materializes before our eyes. Bedraggled, unshaven. Edgy. MCKENNA. HE’S USING THE PREDATOR’S CLOAKING BALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN UNSAVORY PATRON sits at a table, alone. A VOICE: MCKENNA’S VOICE (0O.S.) Dominguez. McKenna “DE-CLOAKS,” again using the Predator device. See to WALK OUT OF THE WALL. DOMINGUEZ, suitably terrified -- McKenna TOSSES A BOX onto the table: THUNK--!

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: This needs to get across the border. U.S.A. No molestar, comprende? McKenna sweeps side tattered DRAPES to reveal a squat, UGLY building. The U.S. CONSULATE. MCKENNA (SUBTITLED) (CONT’D) Mail out of the consolate has immunity. Get it on the embassy truck. Dominguez eyes the parcel.

dialogues.speaker: DOMINGUEZ, (SUBTITLED)
dialogues.text: I am very scared of the way you appeared to materialize out of the wall. McKenna plunks 12 thousand pesos on the table. In English

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Do it. Or I’1ll find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna steps outside, affecting nonchalance --  11. The CLATTER of M4s being hefted and aimed at his HEAD. A SUITED MAN steps into view. Intense, calculating eyes. Clearly in charge. For the record? Agent TRAEGER, CIA.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: McKenna. You’ve been busy.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? Traeger flashes his ID. Gestures to the police.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: My friends here’1l escort you to the airfield. Got a DC-8 all gassed up and ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Wow. Thanks, pal. Where to?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Can’t decide. Either Six Flags, or a remote secure prison.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I don’t like roller coasters.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: There it is, then. He FIRES from the hip. A DART embeds itself in McKenna.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A proud sign:

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE G. GORDON MIDDLE SCHOOL
dialogues.text: “Home of The Warriors”

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: as it topples a WHITE PAWN on a chess board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room’s hushed. Respectful. Because at lunchtime, thos tabletops with the sinks? They make way for THE CHESS CLU  12. SIX or SEVEN games, in progress. The SCIENCE TEACHER eats lunch at his desk, as... oh, yeah. We should probably men

dialogues.speaker: THE AWKWARD KID
dialogues.text: Eating a sandwich with the crusts cut off as he wanders, scrutinizes every game, like a NASA scientist. This is RORY, 12. He doesn’t know it yet, but he’s going to save the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BULLIES stand near a fire alarm, daring each other to pull it. Meet E.J. and DEREK. They will grow up, get bald and attempt to sell you a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarm PEALS, deafening. EVERYONE’s up like a shot, quickly SHUFFLING OUT of the room. Leaving: RORY, who -- nobody notices -- is curled up in a FETAL BALL; fingers in his ears, eyes squeezed shut, the alarm like fingernails on a chalkboard to him. E.J. AND DEREK appear at the door... Spot Rory, who flinc a deer in headlights. The bullies move in for the kill...

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Hey, E.J., you hungry?! E.J. Hell, yeah! You know what I’m hungry for? An ASS BURGER! He KICKS Rory. The nick-name confirms our suspicions: the awkward kid is awkward for a reason: the autism spectrum.

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Mm, that sounds delicious! A big, juicy ASS BURGER. Derek gets his kick in. They’re about to unleash more whe -- the alarm STOPS. Sudden, unnerving quiet. Time running out, E.J. and Derek look around for one last indignity. They settle for this: KNOCKING OVER ALL THE CHESS PIECES. Every game ruined. He and Derek trade a LAUGHING high-five, and they’re GONE  13. For a quiet, electric moment, Rory is alone in the room. His eyes flicker across the chess boards: mental inventor Beat. Then -- he SCRAMBLES INTO ACTION. It takes a moment to register what he’s doing. Another to believe it. He puts back every chess piece on every board exactly as were before the fire alarm.. The Chess Club members filter in and return to their game none the wiser. OFF Rory, beaming silently -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading home. Rory LOPES along, talking to himself. Sudde a strident BARKING from behind a picket fence, where:

dialogues.speaker: A PIT BULL
dialogues.text: GROWLS and SNAPS from between the posts. Rory freaks; gives the dog a wide berth, clearly terrified. INT. KITCHEN - RORY’S HOUSE - DAY The sound of a KEY IN A LOCK, then Rory comes through the back door. Replaces the key under the porch mat.

dialogues.speaker: A STAIN
dialogues.text: Briefly makes him FIXATE. Seepage. A WATER SPOT. He grabs paper towel, delicately blots away the run-off -- goes to the refrigerator. On which, a hand-written note: SPENT 1.5 HRS CLEANING HOUSE. IF YOU MESS IT UP, I WILL CUT YOU.

dialogues.speaker: XOXO MOM
dialogues.text: A doorbell RINGS off-screen, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory opens the door, is greeted by a POSTAL WORKER.

dialogues.speaker: POSTAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Quinn McKenna live here? Rory blinks, not sure what to say. POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) Didn’t mean to stump you. How’s this: is Quinn McKenna your mom, or your dad?  14.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: (nods) Dad.

dialogues.speaker: POSTAL WORKER
dialogues.text: Now we’re gettin’ somewhere. He upends a handcart -- dumps a big stack of LETTERS AND BOXES onto the porch. POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) His P.O. box payments are past due. I’m real sorry. He starts away. Hesitates. POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) Guess he’s not around much, huh? Rory nods. Awkward. The postman frowns: POSTAL WORKER (CONT’D) Lotta D.C. post marks. Government work?

dialogues.speaker: MOS 11B3VW3.
dialogues.text: The postman, confused. RORY (CONT’D) Military designation. (beat) He kills people. The postman decides he’s done here. Rory watches him go, as we PAN the huge stack of mail, so that WE SEE: McCKENNA’S PARCEL FROM CUBA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY BRACKETT, 27, sits on a bench, red penciling papers LEASHES dangle from one arm... a dog BARKS CRAZILY 0O.S.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to unseen dog) Summer! Stop that! That’s not yours, does it look like it’s yours?  15. A JOGGER with a dog runs by; eyes Casey. Perhaps “ogles” would be more apt. He backtracks. Jogs in place beside her, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: How’s it goin’? He huffs, as though having just pushed a boulder uphill. Elaborately towels his neck. A curt DOG-YELP, off-screen

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to unseen dog) Teddy! Knock it off, you can see she doesn’t like that! The jogger, persistent. Extends his hand:

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: Seen you around here. Doug Amaturo. He conspicuously scritches the ears of his designer DOG - JOGGER (CONT’D) This is Barkolepsy. She has a... sleeping thing. She’s a lab--

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: -- Labradoodle. Hypoallergenic cross between a poodle and a labrador. Casey STANDS, starts to walk. Persistant Guy, following -

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: (impressed) Right. That’s right. Are you a breeder?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Science professor. Berkeley.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: What do you teach?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Evolutionary biology. The science of how creatures change, adapt.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: You mean, like... how a man changes when he meets an attractive woman? Casey grins sourly.  16.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: More like -- survival of the fittest.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: You believe in that stuff?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You mean science? Yeah. Yes, I do. (beat) It’s funny, Darwin thought it was about strength, agility, intelligence... These days, you just have to be a rich, fat white guy.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: I... what?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Drop a CEO into the Serengeti. Only question -- what color animal shits him out. My vote? Reddish-tan. The Jogger: Gulp. He nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: JOGGER
dialogues.text: Um, I don’t wanna hold you up so... He BOLTS. Casey reaches in her jacket, fishes out a silve FLASK -- swigs -- A kindly OLD LADY looks up, says:

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: I couldn’t help overhearing. Can I ask you something, professor?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: What do your students call you?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: “Professor,” mostly.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: (smiles sweetly) Maybe they should call you Sunshine. A VOICE interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Doctor Brackett?  17. Casey turns -- THREE CIA AGENTS stand there. A SEDAN with government plates idles ominously behind them. The lead agent is CHURCH, 30s.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CHURCH
dialogues.text: I understand you enjoy star gazing. Casey blinks. WIF? THEN we get it: some kind of CODE. AGENT CHURCH (CONT’D) My men will take care of your dogs. Would you come with me, please? OFF Casey, rattled. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey and the CIA man climb into the back. As the driver pulls out, she looks out the back -- at her dogs. AGENT CHURCH (CONT’D) Dog person, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Hey, they don’t judge you, they don’t lie. People have hidden agendas. Animals just love you, or-- tear your throat out. I kinda have to respect that. Church hands her a file folder.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CHURCH
dialogues.text: How are you with higher forms of life?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I wasn’t aware there were any. As she opens the file, he shines a pen light to illuminate the TOP SHEET:

dialogues.speaker: CLASSIFIED
dialogues.text: The letterhead? A familiar eagle-and-shield insignia: CIA. The page has been stamped TOP SECRET:

dialogues.speaker: MEMORANDUM FOR CLEARED PERSONNEL
dialogues.text: SUBJECT: Class 4 Incursion -- Cayo Muerta, Cuba Casey frowns. Glances at the agent. Is this a joke? She speed-reads the next page. A BRIEF on the discovery of the ESCAPE POD in the jungle. Then -- 8X10 PHOTOS:  18. The debris field; the charred escape pod. Next -- McKENNA MILITARY PORTRAIT -- the one Traeger was showing the loca in Cuba. She flips to THE LAST PHOTO; draws a sharp breat

dialogues.speaker: SATELLITE PHOTO
dialogues.text: Through trees, vines... a figure. Blurry. Indistinct. It’s a photograph of THE PREDATOR. As we PRE-LAP A CLAP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning dances across the Texas plains as the clouds op SUPER: VETERAN’ S ADMINISTRATION

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCHIATRIST, (OVER)
dialogues.text: So, you're denying what you said about some “thing” in the jungle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCKENNA sits in a plastic chair at a table, the rain beat on a skylight high above. He’s wearing an orange jumpsuit

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I thought this was a psych eval. The V.A. PSYCHOLOGIST stands by, watching a MED TECH attach two pnuemo-tubes around McKenna’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: So why the polygraph? The Med Tech attaches finger pads and a blood pressure cu

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: It’s common with high risk civil servants. We need to know if you pose a threat.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I’m an assassin. Figured posing a threat was kind of the fucking point. V.A. PSYCH (smiles) I meant to the general public. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OR yourself. You’ve been... struggling with PTSD, it’s in your file. McKenna exhales. NOW he gets it.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I get it. You’re not here to find out if I’m crazy -- you're here to make sure the label sticks.

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: You think you’re being railroaded?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I can see the tracks on the floor. Off the Psych’s sudden raised eyebrow: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I don’t really see tracks on the floor. Relax. The Psych nods:

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: But you do see a vast... cover-up. The psychologist switches on the polygraph machine. A laptop GLOWS with a graph of McKenna’s vitals. Game on. V.A. PSYCH (CONT’D) Tell me about Cayo Muerto, Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: People died. I saw something I wasn’t supposed to. Pretty simple. The psychologist looks at the polygraph. Barely a flicker. All graphs straight as arrows.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: You’ re gonna have to do better’n that, doc. I was tortured for 48 hours in Kandahar.

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: You think I’m the enemy, don’t you, Lieutenant?  20.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I think you want me to say something crazy, so you can lock me in a room and throw away the room. That’s what I think.

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: Maybe some time in a quiet room would do you some good.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: You know what would do me some good? Knowing who -- or WHAT -- killed my men. And what that thing in the jungle was. AND why the fuck a Black Ops helicopter conveniently showed up out of nowhere to make sure there weren’t any witnesses. (beat) Knowing all that shit? THAT--? That would do me some good. The Doc looks at the polygraph screen. NOW some flickers. Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCH SPECIALIST
dialogues.text: Let’s talk about Kandahar. A SPIKE on the graph.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Oooh, BIG spike. You got me now.

dialogues.speaker: PSYCH SPECIALIST
dialogues.text: You were pinned down. You lost a friend. You got captured, interrogated. Forget the details, but since then--? You spend most of your time in country... estranged from your wife and son because you don’t feel like -- well, you deserve a normal life. You feel like a... stranger on your own planet, don’t you, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (huge) An alien, you mean? The molecules in the air stop moving. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Like the one in the jungle, right? His eyes gleam. A sick grin. Goading.  21. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Is that good? Is that what you wanted? Do I get a cookie now?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE POLYGRAPH MONITOR
dialogues.text: All graphs SPIKING spastically. If he was fighting the appearance of being crazy... he’s failed. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I think we’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: V.A. PSYCH
dialogues.text: As do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like a prison bus idles in front of the administration building, as STAFF escort McKenna into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna DROPS into a seat. The bus jerks forward, RAIN SPATTERING the windows. While, in the darkness... SEVEN MEN in prison scrubs; eyes that have seen shit that would turn your hair white. McKenna notes a hulking form manacled beside him. Also in 30s, with a comma of dark hair and a scar across one eye. Meet NEBRASKA WILLIAMS. He notices McKenna’s gaze.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Got a smoke?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Pretty sure they don’t allow that on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Can’t blame a guy for trying. After a pause:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I’m McKenna. You?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Nebraska.  22.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Is that your real name?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Name’s Gaylord.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Good call. McKenna looks out the window thoughtfully. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) How’d you snag a ticket on this shitmobile, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (impassive) Killed my C.O. This gives McKenna pause. For servicemen, this is not small potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Any particular reason?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (another shrug) Guy was an asshole. McKenna sits very still. The bus drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desolate. Windswept. A small cluster of squat buildings guarded by razor wire and ‘NO TRESPASSING’ signs.

dialogues.speaker: AN HH-60 PAVE HAWK APPEARS
dialogues.text: And SETS DOWN, dust swirling. TWO SECURITY MERCS jump out, assist CASEY from the open hatch. (NOTE: “Project: Stargazer” is guarded by Private CIA- HIRE MERCENARIES like the ones McKenna saw in Cuba. They are NOT U.S. MILITARY SERVICEMEN. The short version? Stargazer = BAD GUYS; U.S. Military = GOOD GUYS.) A GATE CLATTERS OPEN -- REVEALS a small, square structure. The size of a one-car garage. A MERC goes to the code box as Church hands her a clipboa  23.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CHURCH
dialogues.text: Non-disclosure agreement.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I signed that when they recruited me, two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT CHURCH
dialogues.text: It’s a rider. New information’s come to light in the last forty- eight hours. Reluctantly, she signs the NDA; is gestured forward. Chur remains behind -- conspicuously. He doesn’t have clearanc The code box emits a hollow CLICK! and BLAST DOORS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, compact room. A TECHNICIAN stands at a work statio Scanners; cameras; printers. On the wall: A BIG RED BUTTO

dialogues.speaker: I.D. MONTAGE
dialogues.text: as the TECHNICIAN scans Casey’s RETINAS -- her HAND PRINT -- A BAR CODE prints out -- then Casey is stood against a bare wall, and off a digital camera FLASH--

dialogues.speaker: A LAMINATED PHOTO ID BADGE
dialogues.text: Now hangs around her neck. She looks up, awkward. Now wha The Technician turns to the big red button; SLAMS IT -- THE WHOLE ROOM SHUDDERS and we hear a WHINE from all around us because... THE ROOM IS AN ELEVATOR. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door slides OPEN TO REVEAL... A VAST UNDERGROUND COMPLEX. TECHNICIANS bustle to and fro, including (as Casey duly notes) some with lab coats and scrubs. Casey is drawn into a small

dialogues.speaker: VIEWING ROOM
dialogues.text: Like an operating theater, looking down through raked glass into the MAIN LAB. She sees MED TECHS IN BIOHAZARD SUITS around a custom-bui table with stirrups and monitors. Take a breath now --  24. Because there, strapped to the table, is something she’s waited her whole life to see: an actual, living, extra- terrestrial life form. In this case--? A CAPTURED, UNCONSCIOUS PREDATOR. An involuntary gasp from Casey, as we see in her eyes: her world has changed.

dialogues.speaker: O.S. VOICE, (COLWELL)
dialogues.text: Ma’ am. She SPINS, almost jumps out of her skin. A bespectacled man in the doorway behind her: DOCTOR SEAN COLWELL.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: Didn’t mean to startle you. I’m Doctor Colwell. He enters, shakes her hand. COLWELL (CONT’D) I’m told you pretty much wrote the book on evolutionary biology. Casey’s still rattled by the sight of the Predator.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Four, actually. (sheepish) Um... books...

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: So you know your stuff. How’d they rope you into this..? She looks back into the lab below. Pensive.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I wrote a letter when I was six. Said I loved animals and... if NASA ever found a space animal, they should call me. (beat) Couple years ago, they put me ona short list because of a paper I wrote on hybrid strains. A computer had cross-referenced my letter.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: (smiles) NASA still had it, huh? Casey shakes her head.  25.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) The Oval Office. (beat) I wrote the letter to Clinton. He thought it was cute so it’s been in there ever since.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LAB BELOW
dialogues.text: TRAEGER (the CIA man we met in Cuba) squints up through the glass of the viewing booth. Keys an intercom button:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: (on intercom) Doctor Brackett..? She nods, tentative. He gestures. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Would you like to meet the Predator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White. Sterile. Casey and Colwell enter through an airlock hatch. It SEALS SHUT with a HISS, air-tight.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-RECORDED VOICE
dialogues.text: Chamber secure. Remove garments.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to VOICE) You’re not gonna buy me a drink first? She and Colwell start to strip, separated by a partition.

dialogues.speaker: DECON
dialogues.text: CASEY, NAKED in a new chamber -- the room flares WHITE HOT. BURNS OFF her outer layer of skin -- then:

dialogues.speaker: PRE-RECORDED VOICE
dialogues.text: Protocol complete. She dons a HAZMAT SUIT, all business. Dismissive of her nudity. She knows she can halt traffic, doesn’t much care Colwell appears beside her, also in HazMat. Goes to the door. Presses his eye and hand to scanners:  26.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: Colwell, Sean H. The LAST HATCH SHUSHES OPEN, and Colwell leads the way in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traeger approaches her, hand extended:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming. I’m sure - - (an understatement) -- you have questions.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Two, actually. She nods to the dormant Predator. CASEY (CONT’D) Why do you call it “the Predator”?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Just a nick-name. The data suggests it tracks its prey, seems to... well, enjoy it. Like a game.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That’s a hunter.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That’s a hunter. Not a predator. Predators kill for food, to survive. There’s only one animal on earth that hunts for sport. Traeger tries not to roll his eyes; “liberal.” Casey paces beside the Predator. Regards its mandibled features with something akin to wonder. Whispers:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) You... are one beautiful motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: I’m going to assume your second question is: why are you here? An ironic grin from Casey. “Bingo.”  27. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Our test results yielded something a little... odd. We were wondering if maybe you could shed some light on it. He nods to COLWELL, who produces a TABLET. He shows Casey a read-out. She studies it for a second... then blanches.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) We ran the genome sequence ten times. This specimen has --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: -- human DNA. She looks at them, baffled. How is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: We know about spontaneous speciation. Mostly plants and insects, but --

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: -- some mammals. Sheeps, goats. Red wolves are known to be a hybrid of coyotes and gray wolves.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Exactly. Possibly some form of recombinant technology, or...

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Guys, I get it. (beat) You want to know if someone fucked a Predator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trundling through the night; rain-lashed.

dialogues.speaker: ON MCKENNA, ASLEEP
dialogues.text: In the strobing dark; rain drums like GUNFIRE at the wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKENNA, several years younger, in desert camo, flak, ful battle rattle. He and his squad TAKING COVER, breathless. He glances at the SOLDIER next to him. Pale, trembling. Bleeding out from stray shrapnel. The soldier KEENS with pain, as -- urgent VOICES, close by. Speaking PASHTO. The wounded soldier MOANS loudly. Shit. He’s going to giv away their position. McKenna GRABS him; CLAMPS A HAND ove his mouth as the TALIBAN SOLDIERS get closer -- And as the soldier BITES INTO MCKENNA’S HAND to distract himself from the overwhelming pain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As McKENNA WAKES. No startle-awake bullshit -- simply com to. Fully aware. His HAND, near his head... THE SCAR we saw in Cayo Muerte: prominent. Now we know ho he got it. From the back of the bus, now, A VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: Hey, Baxley! Got a question for ya. How do you circumcise a homeless man? He’s addressing a prisoner at the front, BAXLEY, whose eyes thin to slits. Clearly, these two have a history. COYLE (CONT’D) Kick your mom in the chin! One of the MPs at the front weighs in:

dialogues.speaker: MP ON BUS
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up back there! McKenna eyes his measly protein bar. Says to Williams:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Dinner and a show. Great. (indicates stoic BAXLEY) He just sits there.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: He’1ll kill him one of these days.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What’s stopping him?  29.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: He likes the jokes. McKenna looks to a THIRD prisoner, talking to himself nervously, Tourette’s: FLYBOY. WILLIAMS (CONT’D) That’s Flyboy. Three tours piloting Hueys. Now he gets jumpy when he’s not in the air. McKenna nods to an older Vet -- NETTLES. WILLIAMS (CONT’D) Nettles. Ordnance man. They gave him a medal for blowing up half a mountain in Mosul.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Why’s he here?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Blew up the other half, too. (beat) Everyone’s got a story. What’s yours?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t believe me.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: This is the batshit bus. Try me. McKenna shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: All right. (deep breath) I had a run-in with a space alien. They want to put a lid on it, so... here I am. Williams looks out the window, shaking his head. Tsk tsk.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Goddamn space aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY, examining the dormant Predator. Shines a penlight -- checks pupil dilation.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You ran iris biometrics?  30. A nearby MED TECH nods. Casey turns to Traeger. CASEY (CONT’D) Do you have the file they gave me? The incident in Cayo Muerto..? Traeger nods to the med tech. The file is quickly produce and Casey FLIPS to the blurry photo of the Predator. Poin CASEY (CONT’D) In this photo, it’s wearing some kind of... atmosphere mask, a biohelmet.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: We looked, believe me. She notices something else:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And look at the wrist computer. Something’s missing. Sure enough, the Predator’s wrist computer is OPEN -- an empty slot where the KUJHAD should be. She looks at Traeg CASEY (CONT’D) Where are they? Traeger and Colwell trade uneasy glances. After a beat, Casey re-opens the file. FLIPS to the photo of... MCKENNA CASEY (CONT’D) Is this the man who made first contact? (Colwell nods) I’d like to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: He’s en route to lockdown in a military psych ward.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Well, if you’re going to lobotomize him, can I ask him some questions first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE OF THE MPS responds to a SQUAWK from his radio. SPEAK (“Go ahead”). As he listens, his eyes drift to McKenna --

dialogues.speaker: MP ON BUS
dialogues.text: Read you five-by-five. Out.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gears GRIND. The bus steers to a HALT, sloshing water.. promptly executes a ponderous and awkward U-TURN. THROUGH GLASS: we push in on McKENNA, confused... CUT TO: EXT. RORY’S HOUSE (GEORGIA) - NIGHT Neighborhood SOUNDS: THRUM of cicadas, bad TV, distant sirens. A dinged Subaru Outback pulls into the driveway. INT. RORY’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Rory’s mom, EMILY -- pretty, 30s, beleaguered -- comes through the back door into the kitchen, arms weighted dow by shopping bags. She CALLS OUT:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Rory? I’m home! I got you something! Rory -- ? RORY APPEARS -- Mom gives him a quick kiss. She sees a st of LANGUAGE BOOKS on the counter: French, German, Swedish EMILY (CONT’D) You did one of these after school?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: I did all of them after school. She smiles, fumbles with a bag from Target.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: So look. I got you two options... She pulls out TWO BOXED HALLOWEEN COSTUMES -- Like those Ben Cooper specials from yesteryear. In this case..? EMILY (CONT’D) Pirate..? Or Frankenstein..? She holds up each with equal gusto; he regards her blankl

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: What’s Frankenstein?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You know -- Frankenstein. Mad doctor made him out of dead people? Bolts on his neck? Walks around?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Like “Walking Dead”?  32.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No, Frankenst... Green skin? He met Wolfman? Rory looks at her like she grew a tail. Exasperated, she holds up the OTHER BOX as if her son just won a prize. EMILY (CONT’D) Let’s go with PIRATE -- !! But he’s not really buying any of it. He takes the mask out of the box, reluctantly puts it on. RORY’S POV: The sound of his BREATHING as, through the eye holes, WE SEE: THAT WATER SPOT -- the one on the kitchen WALL, as

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY FLASH
dialogues.text: Rory, a mere BABE in his mother’s arms as McKENNA drives FIST through the SPOT, for reasons long forgotten, and --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: It’s been plastered over; yet the ghost of McKenna’s rage continues to ooze out... Rory puts the pirate mask down:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: It’s too small. The guys’ll... you know. (shrugs) They’1l still be able to tell. RORY’S MOM Tell what?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: That it’s me. (sets the box down) No big deal. Dad’s always telling me to be a big boy. He starts out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I love you, peanut.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: (half-hearted; in Swedish) Jag alskar dig. His mom looks after him, blinking back tears.  33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory comes down the steps to his LAIR: recycled PCs, saved from dumpsters. Multiple ON-LINE GAMES glow. A hanging sign reads: “CONTROL AREA.” Rory sits, fingers blurring as he speed runs through two games simultaneously. But gradually... his distraction wi He turns to look at his work table, ON WHICH RESIDES: THE PARCEL FROM CUBA. He sucks in a sharp breath. Goes to it... and TEARS IT OP like a Christmas present. Reaches in, and removes... Holy shit -- THE BATTLE-SCARRED PREDATOR BIOHELMET. The iconic WAR MASK from five separate films. It DWARFS this suburban boy’s delicate hands. He examines it. Sets it aside, reaches for the next prize THE KUJHAD; the data-storage device. It GLISTENS in his grasp. He hefts it like a light-sabre. Then -- Curiously, hesitantly, presses a button on the device. Nothing. Emboldened, he presses another. And another. And anoth -- BLEEP--! Oooh, shit. A DISPLAY BLINKS ON; GLOWING RED symbols scrolling in cryptic patterns. Rory’s eyes widen as we -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold. Silent. OUR OPENING SHOT all over again, as... A LOOMING SPACECRAFT enters frame. Bulbous. Cockroach- shaped. We’ve seen it before:

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR MOTHER SHIP
dialogues.text: from our opening; docking gantry below still scarred and shredded from where THE ARK detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick, tantalizing glimpses of this new, different PREDAT We still don’t see him fully. Not yet. As we will come to learn: this is AN UPGRADE.  34. It taps a control pad -- and a DISPLAY APPEARS, similar to Rory’s. Speaking of whom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCRIBBLES the symbols from the Kujhad on a PeeChee folder. Glances up -- The symbols CHANGE. Blip-! Just like that, a new sequence. Rory scrunches up his face. Huh. Have you ever seen someone “do math” by using their finge to create invisible equations in the air? Well, that’s wh Rory does now, except... THE SYMBOLS HE WROTE LIFT off the paper, SUPERIMPOSED for us to see. He does some mental calculations, and -- The symbols RE-ARRANGE. (NOTE: This is NOT REAL. It depicts Rory’s mental process We are literally watching him translate Predator language

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He TAPS BUTTONS, causing the display to CHANGE BACK, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE UPGRADE REACTS as his READ-OUT CHANGES, too. A glitch taps the controls, REVERTING it to its previous version -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees the DISPLAY CHANGE again -- and OVERRIDES IT exactly as he did before. “Take that!” And we realize -- Our kid is REMOTELY FUTZING AN INCOMING PREDATOR SPACECRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Upgrade, all business. SLAMS IN A CODE, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With shimmering spasms, its STEALTH CAPABILITY is engaged and the ship literally VANISHES--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinning at the new code sequence. It’s a GAME! Gleefully he punches in the same sequence, only IN REVERSE, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transparent Predator Mother Ship BECOMES VISIBLE AGAI  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE from upstairs breaks the moment:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay down there, kiddo? Rory freezes, tries to sound like everything’s normal.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Just playing games, mom!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Love you!

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Oui, J'aime ma mére!

dialogues.speaker: A TRACKING MONITOR
dialogues.text: as a BLIP APPEARS. Then vanishes. Then RE-APPEARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECH SERGEANT in army khaki watches the blip on his sco

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: The analyst FLAGS his SUPERVISOR.

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Sir? His uniformed SUPERVISOR walks over.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Whatcha got, sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: ANALYST
dialogues.text: Weird-ass bogey, sir. What do you make of it? They watch as the blip VANISHES and RE-APPEARS sporadical OTHER TECHS look on curiously. The supervisor frowns.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: Get me NORAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY, bent over an electron microscope. Intent. Examinin the Predator’s blood. Traeger, over her shoulder --  36. She rises from the microscope, sees a blood centrifuge nearby, a test tube rack just above it. In the rack is: A SINGLE VIAL of membranous yellow substance. She frowns:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. (re: centrifuge) If this is blood -- (re: vial) -- then what’s that? Traeger looks vaguely discomfited. But before he can answer, a LACKEY approaches.

dialogues.speaker: LACKEY
dialogues.text: V.A. shuttle’s here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black-clad MERCENARIES wait for the V.A. SHUTTLE as it trundles toward the chain link perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners, GRUMBLING. Flyboy calls out to the MP at the front (who, we should note, is bald as a cue ball).

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, Kojak! When did they put the middle of fucking nowhere on the itinerary?

dialogues.speaker: MP ON BUS
dialogues.text: Zip it, Flyboy. We’re just makin’ a pit stop.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: “Pit stop.” (to McKenna) This is all your fault, isn’t it? McKenna, uneasy. It’s beginning to seem that way. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fans of War Games will recognize the gallery and massive TRACKING SCREENS. Air Force PERSONNEL watch the bogey on

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE MONITOR
dialogues.text: where THE BLIP is seen moving toward the southern U.S... A GENERAL oversees; STAFF SERGEANT at his side.  37.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Still inbound, sir. One second they’re on the grid, the next they’re ghosting.

dialogues.speaker: NORAD GENERAL
dialogues.text: Radio contact?

dialogues.speaker: STAFF SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Negative, sir. The General chews on a pen. What the fuck is it? Finally:

dialogues.speaker: NORAD GENERAL
dialogues.text: Where’s the 325th?

dialogues.speaker: STAFF SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Lackland, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NORAD GENERAL
dialogues.text: Have them scramble some jets. Let’s not take any chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traeger’s AIDE approaches. Furtive:

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: Sir, NORAD’s reporting a 202 anomaly. Colwell and Traeger trade looks. Casey sees this.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Look, I know I’m new, but -- it’d be swell if somebody would kinda sorta, I dunno... tell me what the fuck is going on here? Traeger answers without missing a beat.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: This isn’t the first Predator we’ve encountered. Casey stiffens. The revelation lands hard. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Apparently they use earth as a kind of “hunting ground.”  38.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: They’ ve left things behind. Evidence. Weapons. Some are even stored in this facility.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Your point -- ?

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: The point, doctor... is that our satellite defense stations have just tracked a new UFOB. (nods grimly to the dormant Predator) Our friend here might have company coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traeger MUTTERS something under his breath --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: They’ re gnarly fuckers, that’s all. Took four of my best just to bring that one down. She blinks. Stares at him:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. It took four--?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: That’s right. So?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: So -- a meth head can take down four men. (re: Predator) Look at it! Traeger looks uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: COLWELL
dialogues.text: What’s your point, doctor?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: My point is you brought it here. To a location where you just happen to store its weapons -- (beat) How do you know it didn’t WANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s when ALARM KLAXONS peal throughout the complex. CASEY (CONT’D) What’s happening? TRAEGER’S AIDE clutches a phone receiver. YELLS:

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: Proximity alert, sir! Bogey’s inbound! Range two hundred miles! At which point, without warning -- THE PREDATOR’S EYES SNAP OPEN. Just like that. Alert. Calm. Calculating. We realize: it was playing poss CASEY LEAPS backward; liberates a TRANQUILIZER RIFLE from nearby rack. She hoists it, BACKS AWAY -- full defense mo

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY GET OUT
dialogues.text: She STABS the code for the DECON chamber. Hatch OPENS. Sh leaps inside, except -- she’s the only one. Everyone else is going for their SIDEARMS as -- Bam--! The Predator MOVES. SNAPS ITS RESTRAINTS like they were paper. RISES from the table, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch CLOSES, sealing her in.

dialogues.speaker: PRE-RECORDED VOICE
dialogues.text: Chamber secure. Remove garments. Casey, sweating. FUMBLING at the catches of her Hazmat su

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECURITY MEN rush to restrain the Predator, but it SWIPES at them with its talons -- DUCKS, PARRIES. TOSSES them like rag dolls. Speed and stealth, mind-numbi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEEING THIS -- terrified -- while at the same time desperately trying to DISROBE. Blood SPATTERS the window  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PREDATOR, rampaging. COLWELL draws a weapon -- but it GRABS HIM by the hair; snags a scalpel in its other talon. Like a samurai -- BEHEADS HIM with the scalpel--! The next second, SLICES O HIS HAND -- Then BEE-LINES TO THE DECON HATCH... Spoils in hand, PRESSES COLWELL’S HEAD and HAND to the scanners. Then, nightmarishly: MIMICS the dead man’s voice exactly:

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR
dialogues.text: Colwell, Sean H. A green light BLEEPS. ACCESS GRANTED--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skin burn complete, Casey’s scooping up her clothes, as -- the HATCH SHUSHES OPEN behind her. She SPINS, naked - - clutching the trang gun. -- And there’s THE PREDATOR. Trembling, breathless, Casey LEVELS THE WEAPON. Pulls the trigger: a dry CLICK--! Jammed. The Predator cocks its head at her. Is it... smiling? And then -- it simply MOVES PAST her. SPARING HER. As Casey breathes in short terrified bursts, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE F-22 RAPTORS slice the sound barrier -- following the Predator ship’s last known position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE LEAD PILOT as he checks his instruments. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO CHATTER
dialogues.text: Catfish one, approaching vector. Triangulate SAM radar, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE TACTICAL MERCS spin round a bend, rifles up. As the clatter past an alcove, two MUSCULAR ARMS SWIPE OUT--!  41. GLTCH--GLTCH! TALONS puncturing flesh; severing brain stems. Two down. The remaining merc SPINS, gun up -- Predator, weaponless... Fuck it -- SCOOPS A MACHINE GUN IN EACH HAND. BUDDA-BUDDA--! The merc topples. The Predator calmly DROP the guns, retrieves Colwell’s head and hand from the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey finishes pulling on her clothes, notices -- on the floor, splatters of phosphorescent GREEN BLOOD. She looks back into the lab -- at the tranq gun CARTRIDGE on the rack. Then... something arguably more important: The mysterious SPECIMEN VIAL she saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Predator approaches a VAULT DOOR; again uses Colwell’ VISCERA to override security. TOSSES THEM ASIDE and ENTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a bank vault, but for Predator technology. The Predator RUMMAGES; tossing items aside violently. Plainly looking for something... but not finding it. Frustrated, it GRABS what it knows -- a new WRIST GAUNTLE a PLASMA CANNON. Finally, snatches up a THIRD object: A bent, scorched BATTLE MASK. With this last, it does an odd thing: lifts the mask to its eyes. With one hand, taps a code on its side, blip-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re seeing what IT is seeing. Here’s the weird part: Wherever it is..? It’s not the room he’s currently IN. Blurry... faulty transmission. Still, oddly FAMILIAR. We’re seeing Rory’s bedroom. WTF? CUT TO: INT. RORY’S BASEMENT - SAME TIME THE OTHER MASK, Rory’s -- leaning against the wall, face outward. A green LIGHT blinking, as it transmits --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see RORY at his bench, back to us... now we SNAP-ZOOM in to a spot on the wall, near the kid’s head: A drawing of a pit bull. Taped there, along with other drawings. In the corner, printed neatly: RORY DECLAN McKENNA, GRADE 6. GORDON MIDDLE SCHOOL The Predator lowers the mask. Turns, with new purpose. Ta wrist and... with a glitching SHIMMER, CLOAKS. Vanishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The V.A. bus STOPS, MID-COMPOUND. ALARMS continue to WAIL throughout the facility. SOLDIERS approach --

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Sit tight. There’s been a breech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCKENNA AND WILLIAMS, apprehensive. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed and clutching the tranq rifle, Casey follows a tr of Predator blood to THE STILL-OPEN VAULT -- immediately it’s been ransacked. What the hell was it looking for? A bleeding MED-TECH stumbles around the corner, sees her:

dialogues.speaker: DYING MED-TECH
dialogues.text: Please... It... it MUSTN’T GET AWAY...

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: It won't. (nods grimly) Not my space animal. She turns -- sprints out of frame, and meanwhile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying in formation. PILOTS scanning the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO CHATTER
dialogues.text: Catfish one, still no visual, check your six two and three, over -- INT. RORY’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - SAME He’s back to his video games. Because of course he is.  43. Then... bored, he picks up the Kujhad. PUNCHES IN THE CODE from before... just for the hell of it, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PREDATOR SHIP APPEARS OUT OF NOWHERE -- smack in the trajectory of the three Raptor jets!

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE
dialogues.text: (filtered) (filtered) Holy shit! Heads up! Bandit! Three-zero- five!

dialogues.speaker: AS THEY QUICKLY COURSE CORRECT
dialogues.text: Milliseconds before impact --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something outside the bus catches McKenna’s eye: A DARK FIGURE -- emerging from a bunker in the distance. hulking, lithe, humanoid chameleon shape. Shimmering.... McKenna nudges Williams, who squints... the thing FLICKER seems to VANISH in mid-stride. Williams stiffens --

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Your little green friend?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Turns invisible?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Goddamn space aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY emerges, into the night. Trang gun at the ready. Co around the edge of a building, SEES a Predator BLOOD TRAI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARM KLAXONS wailing outside. McKenna, fraught. Struggling to concoct an escape strategy. Williams sees the look; doesn’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (re: Predator) That thing killed my men.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Yeah, they’1l do that. Stay on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What are you, nuts? We gotta move.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Exactly. Stay on the bus. McKenna, thrown. Williams looks at him, sidelong: WILLIAMS (CONT’D) It’s a bus. He swivels his head -- a barely perceptible NOD to COYLE.

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: (erupts) Hey, Baxley! If your mom’s vagina was a video game, it’d be rated E for everyone! The SECOND MP rattles the cage door with his baton.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND MP ON BUS
dialogues.text: Knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: Seriously, what’s the difference between five big black guys and a joke? (beat) Baxley’s mom can’t take a joke! Baxley’s out of his seat so fast he’s a blur -- manacles clutched in his fists, he WRAPS THEM AROUND COYLE’S NECK -- choking him--! Coyle GASPS, SPUTTERS. The second MP fumbles with his key ring as the first UNCL HIS SIDEARM, adrenaline spiking. Yells to the prisoners:

dialogues.speaker: MP ON BUS
dialogues.text: Everyone on the floor, face down! THE OTHERS OBEY; kneel with heads bowed, as -- The second MP UNLOCKS THE CAGE DOOR -- GRABS a Remington pump action from its mount. Both men RUN up the aisle to:  45.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF THE BUS
dialogues.text: As they pry the two prisoners apart, the first MP reaches for the baton on his belt, except: shit. It’s not there. BECAUSE BAXLEY JUST NABBED IT--! SWINGS IT into the back of the MP’s legs. HE GOES DOWN hard, as -- SECOND MP whips the SHOTGUN UP. Barely time to register: COYLE, right in front of him, SHOVES the barrel with his palm so it CLOCKS THE MP in the forehead -- CRACK! -- dropping him. Coyle GRABS the shotgun -- And TOSSES IT TO WILLIAMS, who SPINS, cocks it -- K-CHUK! - and levels it at the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Whoopsie. THE DRIVER puts his HANDS UP as Baxley and Coyle -- the b of friends now -- snag the guards’ keys and start unlocki the prisoners’ shackles. A ruse from square one. Shorn of his manacles, Williams takes the DRIVER’S SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I need that alien.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Don’t think he’1l board the bus willingly.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Just get me close. WILLIAMS jerks the bus into gear... and GUNS IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it CLOAKS and DE-CLOAKS itself. One second, it’s there. The next: GONE. Vanished. IT LEAPS, parkour style. Alights on a rooftop, and -- Suddenly pauses, EARS PRICKED. It darts a look SKYWARD as, without warning --

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR MOTHER SHIP APPEARS
dialogues.text: Blasts across the sky. Holy shit. Shearing through the atmosphere, and, with even LESS warning --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Flashing through frame, fucking DEAFENING, as

dialogues.speaker: -- WITH THE V.A. BUS
dialogues.text: It PUNCHES through a fence--! Chain link whipping away --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAMS is DRIVING like a mad man, eyes darting between the SPACESHIP and the buildings below. McKENNA yells: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Open the door!! He YANKS the Remington from Williams. Door, HISSING open

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA DROPS SIDEWAYS
dialogues.text: On the open steps, sighting up the barrel of the weapon. Cold intent. Everything goes SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there it is: through his sight, the trademark Predator DISTORTION. Nearing the tree line, CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY, ON THE RUN
dialogues.text: Tops a ladder, swings onto rusty metal BRIDGE. High groun Surveys the compound... bingo. BLOOD TRAIL, 12 o’clock. A sudden RUMBLE, she looks down, SEES:

dialogues.speaker: THE V.A. BUS
dialogues.text: THUNDERING UNDER the bridge. She times her jump -- DROPS DOWN, ONTO THE ROOF -- thunk! Swivels the TRANQ GUN, targeting the TREE LINE, just as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCKENNA LEAPS FREE, shotgun tight to his chest. He TUCKS ROLLS. Comes up, GETS OFF TWO SHOTS -- too little, too la

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR VANISHES
dialogues.text: Over the perimeter wall. As an afterthought, the creature lashes out: SEVERS a LIGHT POLE -- it CRUMPLES DOWNWARD -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAMS SEES the obstacle. Shit! STANDS ON THE BRAKES --  47.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUS
dialogues.text: COLLIDES with the massive pole, tires BLOWN, as

dialogues.speaker: -- ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Loses her footing; TOPPLES backward. Still clutching the trang gun, she squeezes the trigger involuntarily, and -- THPPP--! A DART imbeds itself in her foot. She ROLLS OFF the top of the bus like a string-cut marionette, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna sees her pitch off the side, SCRAMBLES TO catch h Then quickly registers the ARMED SECURITY MEN moving in from all sides, and hastily (comically) FLEES just as -- WHOMP--! Casey LANDS on the ground with an ugly KLUD! She ROLLS OVER; groggy. So much for Prince fucking Charming.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BUS
dialogues.text: The others SCRAMBLE OUT, as NEBRASKA WILLIAMS spots: A small, open Quonset hut with a column of vintage, army green HARLEY MOTORCYCLES. He yells:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Get to the choppers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the MERCS sees Casey, on the ground: he taps a switch on his VIDEO HEADSET -- CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAEGER has his own glass-like headset with THE MERC’S PO

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (awaiting the order) Sir..? Traeger sighs, deep regret:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: No witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MERC, about to follow orders when a BURBLING ROAR fills the air, and --  48. McKENNA COMES OVER THE TOP AIRBORNE on his howling HARLEY. Launches off an embankmen FIRES MID-AIR, blam-blam-! takes out the dude’s LEGS. Lands. Fishtails madly -- steers toward Casey; pure Steve McQueen. SCOOPS HER UP -- And here come THE LOONIES; Williams in the lead! A phalan of crazy-ass Hell’s Angels. The recovering mercs OPEN FIRE -- as the cycles BLAST FORWARD, out of the compound, as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE F-22S FLY alongside and above the NOW-VISIBLE PREDATOR SPACECRAFT, rocking their wings.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO CHATTER
dialogues.text: Go, zero-two! Go zero-three! AIR-TO-AIR MISSILES spew from the Raptors, and RIP ACROSS surface of the Predator ship. It bucks and WOBBLES, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE F-22s BANK OFF as the PREDATOR SHIP TUMBLES, smoking. A glitching SHIMMER as it manages to CLOAK itself one final time... seconds before it impacts -- And now, an odd sight -- one we hinted at in our opening: An INVISIBLE CRASH. The leafy canopy EXPLODES, then a careening DEBRIS FIELD forming before our eyes -- All that’s missing is the ship that’s CAUSING IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tendrils of vapor rise, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst choking smoke, the UPGRADE rises from its seat. Touches a switch, and A PANEL OPENS, revealing a dank, cramped COMPARTMENT. Inside, barely glimpsed -- The eerie silhouettes of TWO slobbering, four- legged CREATURES... Whoa. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RORY’S ROOM - NIGHT Rory lies in bed. Wide awake. Peering into a tiny KEYCHAIN VIEWER with a light in it: A PHOTO -- Father and son in happier times. RORY sighs. Rolls over. Turns on his bedside table lamp -- And there, on the nightstand, is THE KUJHAD. The BIOHELMET sits beside it; eerie, beckoning. Rory reaches for the Kujhad, but it’s no longer blinking. Shit. He THUMBS buttons to wake it up. Nothing at first. Then.. GLOWS RED. Success! Rory chews his lip, thinking. What ne And then he learns the meaning of the phrase, “Be careful what you wish for.” Because suddenly: SHAPES, moving in his peripheral vision. He looks up. GAS

dialogues.speaker: GIANT, MULTI-EYES SPIDERS
dialogues.text: Crawling on the walls and ceiling. Out of nowhere. All around him/ Terrified, Rory starts to hyperventilate. He STABS BUTTONS in a desperate bid to make them go away Then notices: the spiders are GLITCHING with electronic distortion. He double-takes, SEES -- MONOFILAMENTS OF LIGHT emanating from the biohelmet... it’s the source of the images. Not just images: HOLOGRAPHIC PROJECTIONS. He picks up the helmet, lifts it to his face and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like police video, the spiders are PRE-RECORDED IMAGES OF A PREDATOR HUNT ON ANOTHER WORLD. At his fingertips is A VIRTUAL DOCUMENT of the Predators’ travels across the galaxy. He pulls the mask away, a stew of various IMAGES projecte IN 3D all around him. Including something he didn’t expec What appears to be A MAP.  50. At its center, a highlighted, ALIEN SHAPE. Blinking. A beacon, a marker? Or maybe, just maybe...? A transponder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEBRASKA WILLIAMS smokes a cigarette in the blinking neon of the motel sign. He hears A SCUFFLE, turns to SEE: NETTLES, emerging from behind the sign. Zipping his pants

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Nettles. (nods to motel room) There’s a toilet in the room. Nettles eyes widen, like he’s just seen God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A staccato KNOCK on the door (a code). FLYBOY opens it, lets Williams and Nettles back in. CASEY’s in the bed, sleeping off the tranquilizer dart -- THE REST OF THE VETS gathered around. McKenna, weary, Say

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Don’t any of you guys have someplace to be? The Loonies trade glances. Shrug.

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: V.A. Psych Ward?

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: Military prison? McKenna nods.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Point taken.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: So now what, chief? Your green boy got away.

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: I’m tellin’ you -- TV news, bro. They’1l have to believe you.  51.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Right. And I have some land in Florida to sell you.

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: Just get somebody credible. Like Channel 9. What’s-her-name, the lady with the big heinie --

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: Fool, she’s the meteorologist.

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: She is?

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: (chiming in) He’s right -- one look at her and you can tell whether. The others trade looks -- what does that even mean? Then:

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: If we can get someone to listen --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: And if ‘if’s and buts’ were candy and nuts, we’d all have a merry Christmas. Baxley subsides, grumpily. On the BED, CASEY stirs -- blinks awake. Alarmed to see THE LOONIES surrounding her.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I love waking to the sound of macho bullshit. She grimaces. Fumbles out her CELL PHONE -- Incredibly, McKenna GRABS the shotgun, COCKS IT: Is he gonna shoot he No. He GRABS THE PHONE, shoves it under a pillow, and -- muted BOOM--! The pillow’s a smoking ruin. PHONE, vanquis CASEY (CONT’D) (stunned disbelief) Are you crazy--? A beat. Then a SMALL CHORUS:

dialogues.speaker: THE LOONIES
dialogues.text: Maybe. A little. I dunno, probably. (etc.) McKenna ignores them. Turns to Casey.  52.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Use your head, lady. You want them tracing that phone?

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: (chiming in) Question. Everyone looks at him --

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) (to McKenna) How much you askin’ for this land in Florida? Casey huffs impatiently. She starts up, heads for the doo

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You guys can play house if you want, I have dogs to feed and midterms to grade --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Don’t be stupid. She looks up sharply. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) They tried to put a bullet in your head back there. (eyes smouldering) You’re expendable. Just like the rest of us. That STOPS her. She exhales. Looks round at the “unit” --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Expendables, huh? More like the Seven fucking Dwarfs. Nettles grins bashfully -- Casey sighs. CASEY (CONT’D) Can I borrow a phone, at least? I need someone to feed my dogs. She flops in a chair. Gazes up at McKenna. CASEY (CONT’D) You saw it first, didn’t you? The Predator? (off his quizzical look) I read the file. Those men it killed -- yours?  53. McKenna nods, grim. McKenna’s CASEY (CONT’D) I figured. You may as well have written their script. Psycho ex- sniper. PTSD, divorced... even got a flaky kid who curls up ina ball, it’s perfect -- eyes blaze. She shrugs: CASEY (CONT’D) I’m just telling you what’s in the file.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: It said “flaky?”

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That was an unfortunate embellishment. Can we move on?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (joining in) We can start with what you were doing at a supposedly abandoned military base -- full of private soldiers. Mercs.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I’m an evolutionary biologist. I was on call in case of... you know, contact. McKenna thinks it over, paces. Stops, exhales raggedly...

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: If we wanna keep breathin’, we gotta find this thing. Expose it. We all agreed? A look goes round. A bonding moment... exiles, all; perfect scapegoats. No none will miss them. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Good. First things first. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: The Predator? Well... (shrugs) It has human DNA, for one thing. The loonies react. WHAT?  54. CASEY (CONT’D) That’s not all. I was there when it escaped, it... I think it was looking for something. McKenna goes pale with realization.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Its equipment. He looks up -- realizes all eyes are on him. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I took it. So I’d have evidence. (swallows hard) I... I think I know where it’s headed. Pause. Nettles clears his throat:

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: We’re gonna need some ordnance.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: “Ordnance”?

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: You know. Weapons and shit. Nebraska Williams’ brow furrows. Plotting.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: I know a guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parked, two-tone WINNEBAGO SUPER CHIEF. From inside:

dialogues.speaker: TV SOUND, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: the 41 year-old came to this Texas home to meet our decoy, whom he believes to be an underage girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every square inch CRAMMED with war mementos and weaponry. Been to a gun show? That. A grizzled man in a WHEELCHAIR watches TV. Master Gunnery Sergeant GARRISON CUTTER, 60s.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS HANSEN, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: And what are you up to today?  55.

dialogues.speaker: PERVERT, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Just came to hang out.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS HANSEN, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: I see you brought some condoms and some Mike’s Hard Lemonade. There’s a RAP on the door, and Cutter ROLLS himself the entire three feet to answer it as he RAISES AN M16. He opens up enough to see a sliver of a face:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Gunny.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Well, if it ain’t Nebraska Williams.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Just wonderin’ how’d you feel about a little recon mission... Cutter peers through the crack in the door, SEEING: THE GROUP OF LOONIES in the moonlight. McKenna. The other The very uncomfortable, but equally appealing... CASEY. Behind him: dirty laundry. Take-out containers. A cat YOW

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Let me check my schedule.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BASEMENT (RORY’S HOUSE) - EVENING Rory, in his “Control Area” wearing the Frankenstein mask his mom bought him. He pulls it off, frowning. Lame. Then -- a scuffling SOUND at the basement window. He turn SEE what appears to be...

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE, FOUR-LEGGED ANIMAL
dialogues.text: SNIFFING at the window. The neighbor’s pit bull...? It disappears -- he doesn’t pay it much mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMILY does the dishes -- oblivious as RORY, clutching something, furtively heads out the back door BEHIND HER. PRE-LAP: the SOUND OF A DOORBELL RINGING, and --  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily opens the door to reveal: TRAEGER, flanked by armed SECURITY MEN.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Mrs. McKenna? (flashes his ID) Can we have a word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL MCKENNA and the rest of the vets, HIDDEN IN THE BU with field glasses and talkies. Williams aims A SHOTGUN M at the house, allows them to hear the conversation:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Let me guess: he’s done something crazy.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Why would you guess that..?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Because the look on your face says he’s not dead, and yet here you fucking are. STEVENS notices a locked GUN CASE in the adjoining study.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Those are his. He’s a hunter. (sighs) Look, I haven’t seen Quinn for a year. He’s on assignment.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: How about your son -- where is he?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Around here somewhere. Why?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Mind if we speak with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traeger and the security men come down the stairs, finding Rory’s lair... but the kid? Nowhere to be seen. RORY’S MOM That’s weird. If he’s not in his room, he’s always here. He said he was going trick-or-treating, but...  57. She frowns. SEES the two discarded costumes on his work table. Why would he leave without his costume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RORY timidly roams the neighborhood, surrounded by costumed trick-or-treaters and their parents. His head, ENCASED IN THE PREDATOR’S BIOHELMET. The KUJHAD, clutched by his side. Swell costume. Navigating’s a bit tricky, he stumbles a little -- RORY’S POV: Human HEAT SIGNATURES. Every direction. INT. WINNEBAGO (NEAR RORY’S HOUSE) - NIGHT CUTTER at the wheel, taking watch. At the NOOK in back, C squints into a microscope. Murmurs, under her breath --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: It’s like a supermatrix of tryhydroxy and amino acids... She pulls back from the lens. Blinks, incredulous: CASEY (CONT’D) With evidence of recombinant gene splicing.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: If I’m right..? It means they’re trying to upgrade themselves. She picks up a TALKIE, keys it: CASEY (CONT’D) McKenna? I’ve found something. EXT. OUTSIDE RORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT McKenna’s TALKIE SQUELCHES -- he quickly turns it down. Then he freezes -- notices something in the shadows: THAT “DOG” FROM EARLIER. Sniffing at the basement windows INT. RORY’S HOUSE - SAME Inside, Traeger ALSO hears it. Stops, looks toward the ba of the house. Nods to TWO OF HIS MEN to check it out --  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAEGER’S MEN EMERGE from the house and fan out.

dialogues.speaker: WITH ONE OF THE SECURITY MEN
dialogues.text: Flashlight up. He catches a glimpse of “the dog” as it pads away into the brush. Keys his talkie:

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY DETAIL
dialogues.text: I’m on it. Triangulate on my signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Man SLAPS a bug from his cheek. Then, a GRUNTING SOUND from nearby. He WHIPS HIS FLASHLIGHT ONTO

dialogues.speaker: AN ARMADILLO
dialogues.text: Foraging in a pile of garbage. It looks up, beady-eyed --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY DETAIL
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) You scared the shit out of me, you little walking helmet. Which is when -- the armadillo SCREAMS (yes, they do that It’s looking past the Security Man, who HEARS a throaty CLICKING SOUND behind him, and SPINS, face-to-face with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE OF THE FOUR-LEGGED CREATURES from the ship! Yellow, albino eyes. MANDIBLES. The man turns to RUN -- BUT HE’S BLOCKED by the SECOND CREATURE!

dialogues.speaker: SAVAGE, MERCILESS
dialogues.text: Strangled screams. IMPOTENT GUNSHOTS shatter the suburban stillness as -- EXT. RORY’S HOUSE - THAT MOMENT TRAEGER bursts from the back door with his remaining Secu Man. They RUSH in the direction of the screams and gunsho
