dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: He stumbles to a mute halt, SEEING: THE FIRST OF HIS MEN, splayed inside-out. The other one, nearby. Similarly crimson.  59. Traeger registers alarm, but oddly, not much surprise. He keys his talkie:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Team Edward to Team Jacob. Secure the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MCKENNA AND THE MEN, guns up. CASEY joins them, GRABS a pair of night-vision binocs to SEE:

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO PREDATOR HYBRIDS
dialogues.text: Retreating into the night. She swallows; adrenaline pumpi

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Jesus... (catches her breath) They’re dogs. McKenna looks at her like she has antlers.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: The Predators -- they’re hunters, get it? A mordant grin, despite herself: CASEY (CONT’D) They brought their fucking dogs. INT. RORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT McKenna SLAMS THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR, finds himself face to face with Emily -- HIS WIFE. Stone-faced:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Hi, honey, you’re home. An awkward moment -- then she clocks the shotgun in his h

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Where’s Rory?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Oh, I get it. You think you can just waltz in here and --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I asked you a question.  60.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (calling upstairs Agent Traeger, he’s down here!!

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Nice try. (taps earbud) I was listening. Oh, and “What’s he done now?” Thanks for that.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to say?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: How about, “My ex-husband -- is my he all right?” This catches her off-guard.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I thought you... hit bottom.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Not yet. But hey, the night’s young. (repeats) Where’s our son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna bee-lines to Rory’s “Control Area,” SEES THE PARCEL he sent from Cuba. He shakes it. EMPTY. MCKENNA (CONT’D) Shit -- !

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (on the stairs) What? He ordered some video games.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: No no no no... McKenna rifles through Rory’s stuffs for any trace of the alien tech. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) The whole fucking reason I sent it to a P.O. box was so I wouldn’t put you in danger! Goddammit. (turns to her) We need to find him -- NOW. He BOLTS, heading upstairs again --  61.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Quinn, you’re scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back the way they came. McKenna tosses over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: So you let him order any video games he wants?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I specifically said -- no first person shooters, no combat games. You don’t even check, do you?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Whatever. He has, like, THREE. Jesus-- He turns on her.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Yes. And did you ever think that maybe he plays them to connect with his father?? (catches herself Oh my God, we’re doing this. She STOPS. Sees: THE LOONIES, gathered in her living room. A comical momen as they grin stupidly. Sheepish waves. McKenna, meanwhile: snatching PHOTOS OF RORY from walls, tables. School portraits, holiday pics -- EMILY (CONT’D) What are you doing? Give me those! (to McKenna, re: Loonies) Who are these people?! He calmly takes the pictures from her.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: They’re my unit. They’re soldiers. She blinks, incredulous:  62.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: They look like ushers at a porno theater. (to Williams) No offense.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (to McKenna) The wife..?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: For better or worse. (waves a hand) Emily? Loonies. Loonies? Emily.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Wait, back up -- your unit? (frowns) What happened to Haines..? Dupree?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: They’re dead. (deep breath) And the thing that killed them is looking for Rory. SO. You can think I’m crazy all you want -- He looks her dead in the eye: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) But right now? Our son is ina kill box. He turns to the Loonies: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) I want a grid search. Three teams. He gives the first picture to Williams.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) You go west. (another picture for Baxley and Coyle) You two, east. (one for Nettles and Flyboy) Up the middle. He turns to Emily -- who’s shrugging into her COAT. Snatc up, of all things, a FIREPLACE POKER. He GRABS IT away --  63.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Our son’s in danger!

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: That’s right, and last time I looked -- ? (hefts his GUN) This is match grade. (the POKER) This, not so much. But points for originality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the Loonies: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Objective area’s eight square blocks. Parallel sweeps. Stay on your radios. (beat) Find my son. EXT. OUTSIDE RORY’S HOUSE - NIGHT WILLIAMS AND THE LOONIES split up with military precision years of training back in play. McKenna turns to his wife MCKENNA (CONT’ D) They’ re gonna come back, and they’re gonna ask questions. All that matters is our boy. (hands her a phone) This is a burner, I’11l call you.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I don’t like what you do, Quinn. I never did. (grudging) But watching you do it--?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Turns you on, doesn’t it? A warm look between them; a history of good and bad and everything in-between.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Get out of here before I open that gun case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RORY lifts the Predator helmet, watches OTHER KIDS ringin doorbells, collecting goodies. Timid to try it himself...  64.

dialogues.speaker: OFF-SCREEN VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, Ass-Burger! Oh, Christ. IT’S E.J. -- the bully from school. Rory turn to go the other way. Finds himself boxed in by:

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: What’re you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. E.J. Or what -- ? You’ll wash your hands five hundred times? Rory hurries away. The bullies dog his heels, chuckling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patchy lawn. Porch light OFF. The least inviting house on this or any block. Possible escape..? Rory heads up the steps. Looks back --

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLIES
dialogues.text: On the sidewalk, smirking. No turning back now. Gulp. He RINGS the doorbell. A BUZZ echoes from deep inside...

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: trick or treat..? A VOICE from behind the door: STONER’S VOICE Fuck off. ON THE SIDEWALK -- E.J. and Derek CHORTLE with amusement. Taking the hint, Rory turns. Moves stiffly toward the str A door CREAKS OPEN behind him, and... An unfriendly looking STONER appears in the darkened door

dialogues.speaker: STONER
dialogues.text: Here’s a treat, you little shit. He PITCHES SOMETHING through the air -- Splat! A ROTTEN A SMACKS Rory in the back of the head. Bullies, laughing... The reaction is shockingly swift and spontaneous. PREDATOR MASK POV  65. The interior of the helmet LIGHTS UP. Symbols, scrolling. TARGETING INFORMATION. A tiny PLASMA-CASTER juts forth -- UNLEASHES HELLFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PORCH
dialogues.text: is literally DISINTEGRATED as the doorway BLOWS OUT

dialogues.speaker: ALL AROUND HIM
dialogues.text: EXT. A BLOCK AWAY - McKENNA AND CASEY see the EXPLOSION. Trade alarmed looks -- and RUN -- EXT. STONER’S HOUSE - NIGHT The front lawn, SMOKING. Rory turns toward the slack- jawed bullies, his face the imposing PREDATOR BIOHELMET. The bullies almost shit their pants before FLEEING in abj terror --! Colored CHERRY LIGHTS flash over the scene --

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CRUISER, INBOUND
dialogues.text: Rory pulls off the helmet as a ROOKIE COP draws his weapo

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: Freeze! But Rory panics, RUNS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in his panic, DROPS the Predator biohelmet. He can’t turn back -- so he KEEPS RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUTTER at the wheel, as an APB SQUAWKS from:

dialogues.speaker: POLICE BAND RADIO
dialogues.text: -- male juvenile, ten to twelve years old, metal Halloween mask -- Cutter grabs his talkie, SHOVES IT at the speaker of the police band radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY AND MCKENNA ON THE MOVE. McKenna’s talkie SQUELCHES POLICE BAND RADIO (CONT’D) -- repeat: moving east on Woodruff.  66. McKenna swears. GRABS Casey --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: This way. Move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PREDATOR DOGS emerge from the shadows. Sniffing. One snatches the FALLEN BIOHELMET in its mandibles -- CUT TO: EXT. STONER’S HOUSE - SAME More POLICE CRUISERS, BLOWING INTO FRAME. They jolt to a stop, just in time to see the ROOKIE COP c running, panting and wheezing. He calls to the new arriva

dialogues.speaker: ROOKIE COP
dialogues.text: I lost him! He stops. Puzzled. Looks left -- right -- ROOKIE COP (CONT’D) Where’s my fucking car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAMS drives, slews around a corner--! Keys his walkie

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Eastbound on Buckingham. The kid’s rabbiting, he’s spooked.

dialogues.speaker: RORY, RUNNING
dialogues.text: Between houses, terrified, THE KUJHAD clutched in his sweaty hand -- the very thing the Predator’s after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. JIM & JOHN’S BAR-B-Q - NIGHT RORY rounds a bend. STOPS in his tracks, path blocked by Christ. It’s that fucking PIT BULL -- the one that taunts him on the way home from school. The dog GROWLS. Primal. Then, oddly -- moves RIGHT UP TO RORY. Stops beside him. Rory’s brow furrows with confusion... Then, a decision. He reaches out, tentatively... to pet the dog?  67. The dog doesn’t flinch. Their eyes meet. A sweet, unspoke recognition that they’re not all that different: two eart creatures, just trying to get by. Then the dog FREEZES. A throaty GROWL as it backs away from something OFF-SCREEN, and Rory TURNS TO SEE:

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE PREDATOR DOGS
dialogues.text: Snarling. Vicious. Rory gapes, thunderstruck -- Now the OTHER PREDATOR DOG appears! Thinking quickly: Rory STABS BUTTONS on the KUJHAD, and with that --

dialogues.speaker: OTHERWORLDLY CREATURES APPEAR.
dialogues.text: HOLOGRAMS. The Predator dogs RETREAT, fearful. Nice job, Rory. Until the images FLICKER, and FADE. Damn! The sniffers turn toward Rory -- but just then, A VOICE from off-screen:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Son! AND THERE’S HIS DAD, shotgun in hand. McKenna cocks and FIRES at the sniffers -- K-CHUK-BLAMM! K-CHUK-BLAMM! BUT THE SNIFFERS JUST KEEP COMING. A SQUAD CAR SCREAMS into the parking lot and -- WILLIAMS ROLLS OUT onto the pavement before the car’s even stopped Levels the grenade launcher. Click--! Nothing. Fucking thing’s jammed. As he struggles to fix it, the OTHER VETS MOVE IN, loaded for bear. OPEN FIRE on the Predator Dogs. A HAIL STORM OF ARTILLERY--! The Sniffers barely flinch. Just KEEP -- MOVING -- FORWAR MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Um, Gaylord? Williams finishes a final adjustment on the launcher --

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: I thought I told you -- -- then THROWS IT into McKenna’s waiting hands.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) Call me Nebraska.  68. McKenna SPINS. WHOMMM--! FIRES A 40MM RECOILLESS GRENADE down the Predat dog’s throat. A muted FWHHMPP! from within, and -- The creature BUCKLES. Punch-drunk. Finally topples as... THE SECOND SNIFFER crouches to attack. But that’s when Williams steps forward, a BOLT GUN in hand. He levels it at the creature -- FIRES, AND THE BOLT impales the creature’s forehead. It wavers. List Walks in a lazy circle. Not dead but... no longer a threa Nebraska Williams mutters ruefully: WILLIAMS (CONT’D) Goddamn space aliens. But his triumph is short-lived as he looks to THE POLICE CAR he stole: because standing on top, bathed in the strobing colors of the lightbar is... THE PREDATOR. It STOMPS down the hood of the car, on a bee-line for Ror McKenna pumps the shotgun, unloads: BLAM--! But the thing KEEPS RIGHT ON COMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baxley at the wheel. He GUNS IT -- SLAMS into the Predator from behind at high speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, nothing. The front fender is dented, but the Predator? Just glowers at Baxley like it’s irked. Then -- CONTINUES TOWARD RORY... CASEY appears, CALLS out to McKe

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That thing in his hand! THAT’S

dialogues.speaker: WHAT IT WANTS--
dialogues.text: MCKENNA RUNS -- grapples to wrest the device away from his son. But as always -- THE PREDATOR’S FASTER. The Creature GRABS McKENNA! SLAMS HIM, hard, into an old, neon “Jim & John’s” sign! It CRACKS and SPARKS--!  69. And just as we consider saying good-bye to our lead, McKenna watches, stunned, as the Predator THUMBS A BUTTON on its wrist gauntlet and, believe it or not, TALKS: Guttural. Alien-sounding. But ENGLISH:

dialogues.speaker: GOOD PREDATOR
dialogues.text: Coming... for me... Run... Then -- a throaty CLICKING SOUND. From off-screen. The Predator turns to look. Stiffens; replies, that selfs CLICKING. Defensive. Like two cats YOWLING at each other. The remaining alien DOG pricks up its ears -- looking bac toward the approach of its owner... its MASTER.... At which point, McKenna and the others turn TO SEE:

dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE SILHOUETTE
dialogues.text: EMERGING from the darkness. Rising up -- On first viewing, it very much resembles the iconic PREDA It seems, if anything, more HUMAN than prior versions. McKENNA stands, blinking. Because this new, upgraded Predator? It’s HUGE. TEN FEET TALL. With a SHRIEK, THE WINNEBAGO slews into the parking lot, Cutter at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he catches his first glimpse of THE UPGRADE.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Baby Jesus on a pony. Which is when:

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: THE GOOD PREDATOR RELEASES MCKENNA; raises its PLASMA CANNON-- and TRIGGERS A WITHERING BLAST at the Upgrade--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then another. And ANOTHER..! Nothing. Bupkis. Spit wads. Because this new, UPGRADED Predator? Doesn’t need armor. Its body, its skin -- IS armor.

dialogues.speaker: RORY, MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: Stock still. In shock. McKenna approaches --  70.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Rory? Come on. Rory doesn’t budge. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Son? We have to go. RIGHT... FUCKING... NOW... No time for negotiations, McKenna PICKS UP HIS SON, backing slowly toward

dialogues.speaker: THE WINNEBAGO
dialogues.text: Where Cutter is frozen, gripping the wheel. McKenna and the others board the vehicle slowly; no sudden movements. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) How fast does this thing go? Cutter can’t tear his away eyes from the upgrade.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: Not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE PREDATORS
dialogues.text: As the GOOD PREDATOR MOVES! As if to engage the upgrade - to take him on. But that’s what’s scary. Because we thoug our INITIAL Predator was a big deal. Invincible. But this As Cutter STOMPS the gas, the UPGRADE PREDATOR WHIPS AROU -- COLLARS the smaller Predator -- HEFTS it -- LITERALLY TEARS IT APART BEFORE OUR EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WRENCHES its spine loose -- RAISES ITS BLOOD-SLICKED TROP to the full moon. Emits a primal, blood-chilling SHRIEK. It spins toward the Winnebago -- turns its eyes on us full blast -- and that’s when we see it. REALLY see it: The EYES. They’ve... evolved. Human-looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutter GUNS IT--! and we INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Winnebago SCREAMS along, SWERVING, clipping parked cars -- OUR PRINCIPALS gawking out the windows at:  71.

dialogues.speaker: EERIE GLIMPSES
dialogues.text: of THE UPGRADE, in pursuit -- darting, leaping -- SPRINTING through the shadows alongside the SPEEDING RV. Speed, agility? Terrifying. The term “Predator” redefined

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY, apoplectic, points at THE KUJHAD Rory’s still hold

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Goddammit, McKenna, that’s what it wants! That thing! A massive CRUNCH! as the huge vehicle JARS VIOLENTLY. It’s trying to get in. RORY’s curled up in a fetal ball. Not a fire alarm this t but rather, CRIPPLING FEAR that’s triggered his shutdown. And the Predator device--? He’s clutching it, as if for dear life. CASEY (CONT’D) For Christ’s sake, GIVE IT TO HIM OR WE’RE ALL DEAD! McKenna knows she’s right. And with sudden, terrifying fo violently PRIES HIS SON’S FIST OPEN to wrench it free--! Rory YELPS with pain and surprise as McKenna HURLS THE KU OUT an open window -- ! EVERYONE squints out the back of the Winnebago, glimpsing

dialogues.speaker: THE UPGRADE
dialogues.text: as it scrambles for THE KUJHAD, and... SNAPS IT into the on ITS OWN wrist gauntlet. A last nightmarish glance at our escaping heroes -- then DISAPPEARS into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group just stares blankly, speechless. The only sound, the rhythmic RATTLE of the RV’s Chevy 454 engine. RORY winces, hands shaking. Afraid to look at McKenna. Le terrified of the Predator than the violence inflicted by his father. He HEARS BARKING, and --  72.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Now maybe Rory’s only friend, chasing the Winnebago and BARKING into the night... CUT TO: EXT. JIM AND JOHN’S BAR-B-Q- NIGHT TRAEGER stands over the gnarled remains of the “good” Predator. POLICE and FBI VEHICLES form a perimeter. With trembling hand, he clutches a cell phone, says:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Traeger here. The asset’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stocky, four-star GENERAL, on the phone. Square-jawed, with vaguely malevolent, dark eyes. This is WOODHURST, 66

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Explain.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: There’s a new player, sir. Our nightmare scenario. The genetics are... unprecedented.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: An upgrade?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Affirmative. Pulled our asset apart like a piece of taffy.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Jesus... (ice cold) You spooks over at Stargazer -- you were going to tell me you had an asset in captivity, weren’t you..? Funny how I was only notified once it had escaped.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Of course, sir. It had only been 72 hours, we were ascertaining --

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Sir, I --  73.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Shut up. (beat) Lies are wasted speech. You cross me again, I won’t just kill you, I’1l1 sell tickets. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Understood... General.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: The asset brought something to earth. Something it wasn’t supposed to have. Find it. Then bring it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very late now. The WINNEBAGO, cached in a grove of TREES. Crickets chirrup, peaceful... a breather, in other words. McKENNA’s perched in a TREE. On watch. Glances down at: RORY, huddled among the loonies, drawing in the dirt with a stick. The poor kid’s shivering; barely holding it together.

dialogues.speaker: DIRT
dialogues.text: We see what he’s absently etching with his stick, oblivio -- it’s a crude MAP. And: we’ve seen it before... CUT TO: INT. RORY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT And a RINGING cell phone -- the burner McKenna gave Emily. Frantic with worry, she GRABS IT! HEARS: MCKENNA’S PHONE VOICE (filtered) It’s me.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Please tell me he’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna, on the ground now, clutching a cell phone. Williams, having a smoke nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: He’s fine, he’s with me. I’1l1 bring him home when it’s -- Emily’s eyes flicker off-screen, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, you don’t have to explain. Listen -- remember our first date..? McKenna, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: That night in Buckhead?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Exactly. And with that, she hangs up. No explanation. McKenna frowns. WIF? Williams looks at him, quizzical.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: “Night in Buckhead?”

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (nods; remembering) Yeah... we were going at it in my Trans Am that night, and -- Sudden realization. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) cops were watching us... INT. RORY’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - REVEALING His ex is, indeed, SURROUNDED BY BLACK OPS TECHNICIANS with surveillance equipment. Before they can stops her: Emily POPS the phone’s SIM card, DROPS It into the sink’s garbage disposal -- flicks on the water and the disposal.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You guys fucked with the wrong family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE LOONIES are now climbing on and around the Winnebago, stretching camouflage netting over it. RORY watches.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s gonna work.  75.

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Wrong colors, wrong pattern. They’11 find us. McKenna appears behind him. Puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I think they know what they’ re doing. Rory FLINCHES at the touch, and McKenna quickly withdraws

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NETTLES walks the perimeter, armed. Suddenly -- a familiar, blood-chilling CLICKING--! HE WHIPS around. But nothing. Shrubs. Dirt. Sudden SILENCE. Then -- THE CLICKING’S CLOSER! Nettles SPINS -- A FLASH O THE PREDATOR DOG’S FACE fills the frame, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna and Rory, sitting side by side. Awkward. To break the tension, McKenna fishes in a pocket, produce set of DOG TAGS. He hands them to Rory, who fingers them: COLLETT, RORY T.

dialogues.speaker: AIR FORCE 13006929
dialogues.text: The kid looks at his dad, confused. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Friend of mine. From... An involuntary glance at the TEETH MARKS on his hand. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) from a long time ago. Rory clutches the odd gift; oblivious to its significance

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Weird, us having the same name.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. (smiles) Funny, huh?  76. Pause... then:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Mom says... you’re a killer.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I’m a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: What’s the difference..? Good question. McKenna looks at his son.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: When you like it -- that’s when you’re a killer.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: (nods) Mom likes killing spiders.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: I hate spiders.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: (nods) This is the most we’ve talked. Pause... almost companionable. Then: RORY (CONT’D) I think it was a good guy.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (bewildered) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: The alien. The smaller one. He was trying to save us from the big one. Almost like there’s two sides. (beat) Maybe they’re having a war. McKenna feels a sober chill...

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY
dialogues.text: Tenses, hearing something in the woods. He SPINS, levels his M16 into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Company’s coming.  77. Which is when NETTLES BURSTS OUT OF THE BRUSH -- followed by that goddamn PREDATOR DOG! The surviving one; the one with the bolt in its forehead. But the group quickly realizes: it’s not chasing him. It’s merely following him.

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: Anybody got a goddamn Milk Bone? They watch curiously as the thing wanders like an obedient (if addled) puppy.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Nebraska, you lobotomized the poor sumbitch. The Predator Dog starts toward Rory. Instantly fearful, the kid GRABS a gnarled piece of wood and HURLS IT at the creature! It DUCKS -- turns to look a the fallen branch. Then... PADS AWAY to retrieve it. In seconds, it RETURNS to Nettles and DROPS IT at his fee

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l be go-to-hell. He reaches to “pet” the thing. Gently takes its dreadlock-like appendages in his hand. THE SNIFFER reacts oddly. Suddenly disoriented. The group LAUGHS. Even Rory smiles; a moment of respite. Camaraderi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKENNA enters. Gets himself a beer. CASEY says:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Nice kid. McKenna nods thanks. Sits. CASEY (CONT’D) You know... a lot of experts think being on the spectrum’s not a disorder. Some think it might even be the next evolutionary step.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: All I know is, when his gram comes over, he ignores her and hugs a pillow she made.  78.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: It’s the same love. Just deflected. (cautiously If I can offer an opinion... maybe you're a little bit afraid of each other? He shakes his head, rueful.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Nice spin, but... I think we’re both afraid of me. He takes a swig of his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE VETS continue to play with the beast’s DREADS. As the touched, the Sniffer goes slack, wobbly. Like he’s stoned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna, watching this through the window.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What do you make of those--? (gestures to his hair:) The Marley shit?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Maybe sensory receptors. Like... cat whiskers.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (sips his beer) Anything else, professor? She looks at him grimly --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Just this. -- and produces THE VIAL she stole from the lab. CASEY (CONT’D) They extracted this from the Predator’s spinal fluid. In layman’s terms, it’s like distilled “lizard brain.” The part that kicks in under extreme survival conditions.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Remember I told you they rip out peoples’ spines?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Sure. Trophies, you said.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Right. But if a Predator’s first and foremost a survivor-- (beat) Wouldn’t it make sense to collect DNA “souvenirs”?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: From... peoples’ spines?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Brain stem -- close enough. Look suppose, just suppose, that these space creatures are... siphoning off our lizard brain juice.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: You don’t have to overdo the “layman’s terms” --

dialogues.speaker: CASE
dialogues.text: I’m just saying... it might explain the human DNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna considers this.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Collecting “survival” traits, from the most high-end human specim --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Why stop there? Seriously -- why not other species, too? (beat) Extreme hybridization. That’s why they hunt. To extract the defense mechanisms from the strongest, the smartest, the most dangerous species on every planet they visit...

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: To make hybrids. (looks up, stunned) Are you just pulling this out of your ass?  80.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: This new Predator, the bigger one -- it didn’t need a mask, you notice that? And did you see its fucking eyes? (beat) They’ re evolving, Lieutenant. Changing.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Or being upgraded.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And here’s the clincher. (leans in) Project Stargazer? The shit- show that recruited me? Mckenna shrugs: What about it? CASEY (CONT’D) A stargazer’s a type of flower; an orchid. And not just any orchid --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Holy shit... (softly) A hybrid. Damn. McKenna gets up. Pacing. It’s a lot to digest.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That thing back there... the new one, “Thing Two”? Probably top of the line. “Thing One”? Last year’s model. (re: the sniffer) Old Yeller out there’s another kind. But none of them is the essential Predator. You know why? Because survival is. Because this -- She holds up the vial, locks eyes with McKenna. CASEY (CONT’D) This is the Predator. A SOUND rises outside. Distant WHORPLE of chopper blades. McKenna’s up like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna bursts outside -- looks to Flyboy, who’s stock still, gauging the sound of the incoming copter:  81.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: Sounds like a Pave Hawk. Sikorsky. (looks at McKenna) Not civilian. All McKenna needs to hear. He whirls round --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Lights out! MOVE--! THE LOONIES SCRAMBLE to turn off lanterns as McKenna DIVE into the Winnebago; renders it dark. Everyone freezes... THE SIKORSKY ROARS OVERHEAD, a blinding SEARCHLIGHT rakin the woods. Slowly, the SOUND diminishes. Then... THE COPTER TURNS. Start back in their direction. Shit! McKenna looks around. As the ersatz C.0O., it’s on him to a plan. He looks at his “men.” Motley as they seem, they’ SERVICEMEN, U.S. Vets. And they’re nothing if not loyal.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) Best split up. (to Nettles) You and Flyboy, west. (to Baxley and Coyle) You two north.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: But -- what do we do? And McKenna sees in their faces: they don’t want to go. He grasps at straws to give them something. A mission.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (to Flyboy) We’1ll need air transport. Something that can outrun that Pave Hawk. (looks at Nettles) And maybe some incendiaries. Never know when we could use a diversion. Roger that? And that’s when: The Loonies, God bless ‘em, SALUTE MCKENNA. He looks at them, abruptly moved. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Wish I had coordinates, but...

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: We’1ll find you, sir.  82. McKenna nods. SNAPS back a salute. And with that, the LOO DISPERSE; grabbing weapons, disappearing into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER
dialogues.text: (to McKenna) They know it’s a snipe hunt, right? Rory’s observed this whole exchange. A tentative VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: What’s a snipe hunt?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: When you’re chasing something you’ll never find.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (urgent) Come on. They turn to make a run for it. Get five yards before they’re STARTLED by: The PREDATOR DOG; gnarled stick clenched in its mandibles Try as it might to be adorable, it’s one ugly motherfucke As the HELICOPTER grows louder, Casey makes frantic “shoo ing” motions. But the Sniffer isn’t taking the hint. She spies an errant GRENADE on the ground, SNATCHES IT UP And LOBS it as far as she can, into a ravine. The Sniffer drops the wood and RACES after it. Problem solved. Except --

dialogues.speaker: THE SIKORSKY
dialogues.text: Is now circling the clearing. GOD-LIGHT, stabbing down --

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Touching down. (Loonies and Sniffer, long gone.) TRAEGER steps down from the chopper, wind WHIPPING. His m DRAW WEAPONS on Williams and Cutter, as...

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: (re: Winnebago) Whose idea was the jungle camo? McKenna glances at Rory, who shrugs -- told you so.  83. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Should have used Woodland. Might as well have shot up a signal flare. He approaches Casey. Regards her with a grin, then -- ext his open palm. After a beat, she stiffly hands him THE VI TRAEGER (CONT’ D) There, now. That wasn’t so hard. His men rudely PAT DOWN McKenna and the others. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Where’s what?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: The device. It goes -- (mimes Predator’s wrist gauntlet) -- right in here.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: We threw it out of the RV. That thing has it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traeger ponders.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: You know what I think? I think it’s time for some... robust discussion.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: MCKENNA’S FACE CRACK--! It SLAMS into the ground! Pummeled, caked with dirt. Purplish welts glisten, backlit by searchlights. It'll take a minute, but eventually you’1ll get it: we ar in an abandoned abattoir. A SLAUGHTERHOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKENNA, on his knees. TWO BLACK-CLAD MERCS loom over him

dialogues.speaker: MERC
dialogues.text: You hid it once. In the mail. Where’d you hide it this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BRUTAL KICK for emphasis. McKenna COUGHS blood.  84. MERC (CONT’D) This is getting old, Lieutenant. Cough up some more blood if you agree. Another KICK--! McKenna writhes in the mud... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY, handcuffed to a chair. A few feet away, Traeger pours himself a drink. Holds up the bottle:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Can I tempt you, Ms. Brackett?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Just tell me, why are they fucking HERE? If it’s not to hunt, then WHY? Traeger regards her coolly, shrugs, smiles:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Ms. Brackett, do you remember a few years back when Hostess went bust? There was a run on Twinkies. Snapped up, coast to coast. “Get ‘em while they last”, remember?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What are you saying, we’re Twinkies?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Think about it. How long before climate change makes the planet unlivable? Two generations? One? Casey’s blinks -- dawning realization:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Jesus. We’re an endangered species, and they know it. That’s why they keep coming here -- they want to snap up our best DNA before it goes bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Exactly. Adapt themselves with it, then... move in. Casey blinks, stunned.  85.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What about their own planet?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: We think it’s dying. (frowns) Well -- cooling, to be precise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read the file, they thrive in a hot-house environment. Maybe they want to make a move to ours. It is getting warmer, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey shudders.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And your angle -- the upgrade tech, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: (shrugs) If we can upgrade ourselves? Become the ultimate survival engines--? Why wouldn’t we? Casey looks sick to her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: How would you disseminate it? Who gets it?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Whoever can afford it, of course. He grabs her by the hair. Yanks tightly. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Now something is on that hijacked ship, and I think you know what it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rail system circles the room with meat hooks on it. In one corner, a group of CRYPTOGRAPHERS study the famili PREDATOR HIEROGLYPHICS on a large DRY ERASE BOARD. RORY SITS nearby, drawing with crayons. A lone GUARD keep watch on. Glances at Rory’s drawing. Says, offhandedly:

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: What’s that? Rory shrugs; doesn’t look up.  86.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Map.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Map of what?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Where the ark is. The CHATTER in the room STOPS. All eyes on Rory. A CRYPTOGRAPHER approaches him, slow. Smiles tentatively. Points at the drawing, says:

dialogues.speaker: CRY PTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Um... do you mind if I..? Another shrug from Rory. Whatever. The Cartographer takes the “map” to the Team Leader.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM
dialogues.text: LEADER (sotto) Are you insane? He’s a kid --

dialogues.speaker: CRY PTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: A kid who had that biohelmet for twenty-four hours.

dialogues.speaker: TEAM LEADER
dialogues.text: Even if the ship is there, we still need the key to get in, the entry code’s on the fucking KEY. He gestures at the dry erase board; DOZENS of attempts to translate the Predator language into letters or numbers. TEAM LEADER (CONT’D) That sequence could be a hundred digits, for all we know--! RORY’S VOICE (0.S.) Twenty-two. Every head in the room turns to:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure it’s twenty-two. You can hear a pin drop.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Traeger approaches Rory, feigning nonchalance. Attempts a paternal tone:  87.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Hi, Rory. I’m Will. I understand you know how to access the spaceship. Rory nods, tense. Bites his lip. Traeger grins. TRAEGER (CONT’D) Here’s the thing. We work for the United States Government. Just like your dad.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Except you’re assholes. Traeger’s grin slips. Then he plasters it back on. Holds up Rory’s drawing: the MAP.

dialogues.speaker: STEVENS
dialogues.text: I won’t argue. Question is... will you get me into this ship, or not? Rory stiffens, wary.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: If you let my dad go. Traeger glances at his lackeys. “Kid’s good.” He leans in

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Okay. You want to play grown-up, let’s play grown-up. Man to man..? We’re not going to let him go. Not until you give us what we want. But when you do -- I promise he’1l go back to the V.A. hospital... where they will take good care of him.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: What if I don’t tell you? Traeger shakes his head with disappointment; tsk tsk tsk.

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Oh, now, Rory... I thought we were playing grown-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna, face in the dirt. Groggy. Barely conscious. SEES

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: being dragged to a waiting Sikorsky. Fueled, blades spinn  88. MCKENNA STARTS TO MOVE, when suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: OFF-SCREEN VOICE
dialogues.text: Not so fast, slick. THWACK--! Another KICK to his gut. THOSE FUCKING MERCS, standing over him. He watches helplessly as

dialogues.speaker: THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Lifts off, WHORPLES into the night sky. As it does, one o the mercs draws his sidearm to END this, says to his budd

dialogues.speaker: MERC
dialogues.text: Golf tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: MERC
dialogues.text: Why not? McKenna sees what he’s doing -- COUGHS. Ropey spits of bl

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: You know what... burns me up..? (gasp, cough) You never even... read my file, did you..? The mercs trade amused glances.

dialogues.speaker: MERC
dialogues.text: What makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: ‘Cause you’re makin’ plans... for tomorrow. The mercs, VERY amused by this. MCKENNA (CONT’D) Worst part? Is you... making me lie to my son. I really don’t like to do that.

dialogues.speaker: MERC
dialogues.text: What lie did you tell him? McKENNA, face to camera, grins:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: That I wouldn’t enjoy this. That’s when his HAND DARTS OUT, SNATCHES the guy’s forear uses his other hand for leverage, and -- Crack--!  89. The MERC SCREAMS as McKenna SNAPS HIS FOREARM at an alarm angle, then GRABS the man’s gun, presses it into his eye BLAM--! The MERC DROPS WITH A THUD as McKenna stands, levels the sidearm at the remaining MERC; frozen in place Like the Predator in the lab, he was playing possum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A walk-in. Williams and Cutter, sitting on the floor. They LOOK UP TO SEE: THE MERC opening the thick, industrial door; McKenna holds him at gunpoint, says to the guy: MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Now the armory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MERC rounds a corner -- BYES GO WIDE. HIS POV -- the MAN McKENNA KILLED, wedged into a corner. The guy turns to raise an alarm -- STOPS. His eyes widen. AN INHUMAN SHAPE, LOOMING over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUN at the back of CASEY’S HEAD. She closes her eyes, waits for the shot -- As, abruptly, we hear loud clumping noises from the corridor outside. FOOTFALLS, as

dialogues.speaker: AN INTRUDER, NOW
dialogues.text: Pokes his head around the corner. Snuffling, drooling. As benign as it is INHUMAN: THE PREDATOR DOG. The sniffer. Wagging its tail, no less. Sees Casey, the intended targe of its current game-in-progress... and FYI, in its mouth? THE GRENADE from the clearing. It’s FETCHED it. Brought it back. It DROPS the grenade -- CLUNK! -- right in Casey’s lap. Her ASSASSIN, stupefied.. Casey wastes no time:  90. SNATCHES UP the grenade -- pulls the pin -- SHOVES IT down the guard’s SHIRT BACK. Promptly BOLTS FOR THE DOOR, dragging the CHAIR she’s handcuffed to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hits the deck as -- FWOOM!! -- the room BLOWS OUT BEHIND Blood and dust and dry wall. Smoke clears, and... THE PREDATOR DOG pads out of the room, unscathed. Drops a new toy at her feet. Wait, sorry. Not a toy. The GUARD’S SEVERED HEAD. Casey throws up a little in her mouth as she hears FOOTFA SEES McKENNA, WILLIAMS, CUTTER (in his wheelchair) come around a corner, armed to the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna opens the door a crack. PEERS OUT: HIS POV: SOLDIERS run around the perimeter, taking up firing positions to prevent their escape. McKenna, Williams and Cutter trade looks. Shrug.

dialogues.speaker: CUTTER WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Duck soap. Piece of cake. They LOCK AND LOAD, no hesitation. CASEY gapes. It’s suic

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: See this? THIS is why the army thinks you’re crazy! Except... a SOUND now. A low pulse; BASS VIBRATO from outside. MCKENNA peers through the crack again... and his eyes widen. An involuntarily gasp.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: You’ve got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAPPING in the wind. And on it, an airbrushed, scantily girl (“A New Look for Sexy!”) being pulled by... A PINK HELICOPTER. Yes, pink. The Victoria’s Secret logo on the side, no less, as we REVEAL:  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYBOY AT THE HELM, of course. The other VETS (NETTLES, BAXLEY, COYLE) in the back. THE LOONIES to the rescue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the pink copter LANDS unsteadily and

dialogues.speaker: -- AT THE EXIT DOOR
dialogues.text: McKenna SHOVES IT OPEN, and... OUR HEROES RUN FOR IT, into the open, GUNS BLAZING--! Williams PUSHES THE WHEELCHAIR at high speed; Cutter’s M6 CHATTERING as hot shell casings SPIT out the side -- !

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STOLEN COPTER
dialogues.text: McKenna and Williams provide COVERING FIRE as Casey and t Loonies HEFT CUTTER ABOARD, then -- YANK HIS WHEELCHAIR I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This chopper was built for five people. Current load? EIG Plus a wheelchair. Lufthansa, it ain’t. As FLYBOY LIFTS O MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Very inconspicuous.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: We had to kill seven Victoria’s Secret models.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Tell me you’re joking.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: I’m joking. I’d sooner piss on the Mona Lisa. He throttles up, pulls up on the collective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the copter rises, MERCS OPEN FIRE. Too little, too lat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyboy looks to McKenna for direction. FLYBOY (CONT’D) You got a heading in mind, Lieutenant?  92. McKenna squints down at the rushing landscape. Casey poin

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR DOG
dialogues.text: hauling ass, SOUTHBOUND.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Follow that dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On first blush, we’re back in Cuba. Same tropical foliage same humidity, same goddamn mosquitoes. Then we HEAR: TRUDGING BOOTS. CRACKLE of radio crosstalk. And that’s when we note: a long BUMPY GREEN ROCK. Wait a minute. Did it just... move? Yes, it did. Because it’s not a rock. It’s a fucking ALLIGATOR -- Because we’re in FLORIDA. The gator sinks into the swamp

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER EMERGES
dialogues.text: from the brush, flanked by A SMALL ARMY OF MERCS; poor Rory in tow. An AIDE clutches a hand-held GPS device. TRAEGER’S AIDE We’re at the waypoint. Should be right here. But the clearing is just that: clear. Then, Traeger notic

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: What are those? They’ re DEAD BIRDS, laying on the jungle floor in a wide

dialogues.speaker: A MERC CHEWING TOBACCO
dialogues.text: Examines them. Nudges one with his boot. He SPITS to the side, and -- splat! The spittle HANGS THERE IN MID-AIR. Traeger sees this. Intrigued. Turns to a MERC. TRAEGER (CONT’D) Give me your weapon. (takes the gun) Paint pellets. The soldier scoops some glycol pellets, hands them over. Traeger loads them -- FIRES, twice. THOOK! THOOK!  93. Eerily, the TWO SPLATS OF PAINT stay frozen in the air, COATING AN INVISIBLE SURFACE. Traeger points: TRAEGER (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: FIRE
dialogues.text: The entire brigade OPENS FIRE with a BLISTERING FUSILLADE RORY clamps his hands over his ears, SCREAMS silently. Under the bombardment, a series of spastic SHIMMERS as, BEFORE OUR EYES... THE PREDATOR SPACECRAFT APPEARS--! Its cloaking device short-circuited by the assault. Soldiers gape as -- Traeger tenses. Looks around. Where’s the Predator? But nothing. Silence. A thin smile of triumph:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) We beat it here. (to his aide) Get on the horn. Tell Woodhurst we have his space ship. He turns to Rory -- ushers the boy forward, gripping his shoulder. SHOVES HIM toward -- THE SHIP’S ENTRYWAY And next to the hatch... an ALIEN CODE BOX. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Open it. Rory hesitates. Feeling all eyes on him, he relents. Reac for the code box. TWO DOZEN DUMBSTRUCK SOLDIERS look on - As a little boy inputs the code from memory. SH-KKK! As easy as that, the HATCH OPENS. Traeger turns to his AIDE. Points. You’re coming, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cavernous THRUM oscillates as Traeger looks around, petrified. The technology is clearly alien. Then he notic

dialogues.speaker: THE STASIS CYLINDERS
dialogues.text: INSET around the periphery of the hold. TRAEGER’S AIDE What the hell are they?

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Property of Project Stargazer, that’s what they are. (to his aide) Tell the men to secure the craft; get it ready for transport. I want it moving before that... THING gets here. RORY, meanwhile, has noticed a control panel:

dialogues.speaker: A MONITOR
dialogues.text: On it, THE GRAPHIC depicted in our opening. The stasis cylinders HIGHLIGHTED IN RED with time-code beside them. Except the COUNTDOWN has stopped, MID-SEQUENCE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No longer morning, it’s late in the day... MCKENNA and CASEY, eyeing the rolling country below. Palmettos, swampland -- and, galloping in and out of sight: THE SNIFFER. McKenna whispers:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Go, baby, go. Run to papa. Casey frowns. Points below, WHERE:

dialogues.speaker: THE SNIFFER
dialogues.text: has STOPPED; visible now on a low hill overlooking a road closure, beyond which: some kind of activity. McKENNA raises his binocs:

dialogues.speaker: ABANDONED DIRT ROAD
dialogues.text: Not just “activity” -- it’s THE ARK. Currently in transit THE ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS SWARM round a huge FLATBED TR removing tarp from the spacecraft. Showers of SPARKS as t solder towing rings; LASH steel cables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyboy pops a wad of bubble gum, says:  95.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: Looks like they got it this far by truck. Now they’re prepping to airlift it in. Seeing something, Casey grabs McKenna’s binocs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the eye of the hurricane, giving orders.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: There’s that asshole, Traeger. McKenna goes taut.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: That means Rory’s down there. (to Flyboy Take us down. FLYBOY banks sharply, descends into the trees, as we --

dialogues.speaker: A SIGN
dialogues.text: being strapped to a palmetto tree with wire:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIVE YEAR-OLD kid, cowlick, cutoffs, licking a Popsicle, watches a SOLDIER put the sign up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where a dozen or so RESIDENTS have set up beach chairs to watch. Not a lot to do in the trailer park, apparently. GIRLS IN BIKINIS man A CUBAN FOOD TRUCK; boom-box BLARING A terrible Ricky Ricardo caricature advertises CUBAN PETE’S. Then a bone-jarring BASS RATTLE as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUR MERRY BAND (McKenna, Casey, et al) crouched in the trees near the trailer park, LOOKING SKYWARD as --

dialogues.speaker: TWO BORING VERTOL HEAVY LIFTING HELICOPTERS, (HLH)
dialogues.text: THUNDER overhead, en route to The Ark.  96.

dialogues.speaker: FLYBOY
dialogues.text: Heavy lifting copters. It’s an airlift, all right. The massive copters WHORPLE over an adjacent CRACKER BARREL restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: We’ve gotta get closer to the perimeter. Blend in somehow.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (scoffs) Like this? He gestures to the group, FESTOONED with AK’s, AR- 15’s, holstered glocks -- not to mention TRANQ GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Stand out like a sore thumb.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Yeah? When’s the last time you stopped in a crowd and said, “Hey, that guy over there -- his thumb looks sore.” Be honest. (beat) Fine. We bag the guns. Across the road, the CRACKER BARREL’S DOORS OPEN: And out trudge three men, ALL STRAPPED to the fucking tee Assault rifles. Pistols. They wave heartily at McKenna, h a bucket of chicken --

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Y’all hungry? A ten year-old GIRL scrambles from under the porch, sporting a CROSSBOW and a .44 Magnum.

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: Florida... We’re blending.

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna blend more? Shoot the kid. Claim “Stand Your Ground.”

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Stab a gator and you’1ll be practically invisible.  97.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (exasperated) We done?

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES
dialogues.text: One more. (thinks, changes his mind) Nah, we’re done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes troop into the bustling TRAILER PARK, approach the CUBAN PETE TRUCK. MCKENNA clocks the back of the truck, covered in ANTI-GOVERNMENT SLOGANS -- banners, placards. MCKENNA (to Casey; sotto) You still have your Stargazer 1.D.? She nods, hands it over with apprehension:

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You’ re gonna do something stupid, aren’t you? McKenna and Williams trade conspiratorial grins.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Lady? You haven’t seen stupid yet.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CUBAN PETE TRUCK
dialogues.text: A fenced-off patch of SOD next to the truck hosts a few struggling tomatoes. The PROPRIETER (“PETE”) tends it. MCKENNA approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Sir--? PROPRIETER (“PETE”) Call me Pete. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Well, Pete, my name’s McKenna. Until recently, I worked for the U.S. Government -- He flashes Casey’s (temporary) government credentials.  98.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: -- for THOSE people. (points toward the quarantine signs) Well, guess what, brother? They’re at it again. A cover-up. You think that’s really a toxic leak in those woods? ’ PETE” What, then? McKenna adopts a solemn look.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What if I told you... there’s something in those trees, and it ain’t no man. Cuban Pete tenses. \ PETE” It’s Bigfoot, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RORY is still inside the spacecraft, under guard. He explores... casts his eyes round the interior, notices: An EQUIPMENT ALCOVE. And in it... a PREDATOR BIO-MASK like the one he wore on Halloween. He reaches for it --

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: HEY! Don’t touch that! Rory JUMPS. Backs away, intimidated -- and meanwhile: EXT. DIRT ROAD - SAME The two MASSIVE HELICOPTERS hover overhead, deafening -- RAPPELLING LINES unfurl -- SPECIALISTS RAPPEL down, like a SWAT TEAM. Tactical. Professional. And meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat. Cicadas. TWO SOLDIERS on a JEEP -- manning a ROADBLOCK. They HEAR the roar of an engine, look up. WTF? THE “CUBAN PETE” TRUCK  99. comes BARRELING AT THEM, terrible CUBAN DISCO BLARING, breeches the perimeter, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The food truck TRUNDLES INTO VIEW at high speed--! SOLDIERS CONVERGE, flagging it down. Shouts, cursing -- l your bowels after a Cuban Pete’s supper, this is all high irregular, as --

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: DROPS from an open floor hatch, IMPACTS the dirt, and -- quickly ROLLS OUT OF SIGHT, commando-style --

dialogues.speaker: NETTLES, AT THE WHEEL
dialogues.text: WRENCHES the truck to a halt, at which point:

dialogues.speaker: PLUMP, (YET WINSOME)
dialogues.text: Come piling from within, all with laden trays of hot CUBA FOOD. Soldiers, agape -- one of the girls flashes a GRIN:

dialogues.speaker: BIKINI GIRL
dialogues.text: Y'all brave boys gotta eat, right? The OFFICER IN CHARGE steps forward, apoplectic:

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER IN CHARGE
dialogues.text: We have plenty of damn FOOD, now get this thing turned around --

dialogues.speaker: WITH COYLE
dialogues.text: He watches through a sniper scope. Speaks into a throat m

dialogues.speaker: COYLE
dialogues.text: Shit. We went from Victoria’s Secret to this?

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: BAXLEY spits, says:

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: Relax. These guys are mercs-for- hire, they’d fuck a woodpile on the off chance there’s a snake in it. (suddenly) Whoa. BAXLEY’S POV:  100. From the TRUCK, now, emerges a FOURTH girl. Daisy Dukes, tied up shirt-top... long, blonde (borrowed) WIG -- CASEY, no less. She sashays PAST armed men, DO-SI-DOS right up to the officer in charge -- extends a hand -- Pulls him into a DANCE. Salsa, rumba -- something. The girls cheer. The surrounding soldiers, guns wavering, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAEGER looks out upon the scene, aghast:

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: What in blue fuck is going on? TRAEGER’S AIDE Locals, sir. We’re on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONE SOLDIER trots toward the truck. Muttering, shaking his head... Steps round a thicket -- An ARM lashes out. PULLS HIM IN. McKenna’s coal- blackened face, inches from his --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Where’s the boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC, blaring. Girls dancing. Then, suddenly, Casey’s wristwatch goes BEEP-! Her head snaps round -- she SHOUTS

dialogues.speaker: NOW.
dialogues.text: From the FOOD CONTAINER at her side, she lets drop a spherical object. It bounces..! Shit. SMOKE GRENADE. Pop--! Smoke, BILLOWING. Choking. Cuban Pete’s THREE DAUGHTERS, on it. Three quick tosses, Pop-! Pop-! Pop-! They drop flat, hands on their heads -- SMOKE EVERYWHERE. Cloying. TWO SOLDIERS stagger, looking for a target, when -- THUP!THUP! Both of them DROP LIKE SANDBAGS, thanks to:  101. WILLIAMS -- hidden under the FOOD TRUCK -- wielding @ TRANQUILIZER GUN, and --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: swiftly TASES the OFFICER in the side. He goes down -- sh drops with him -- liberates his SIDEARM, rolls away --

dialogues.speaker: COYLE AND BAXLEY, NOW
dialogues.text: Chiming in with additional SMOKE CHARGES, as

dialogues.speaker: OUR BOY NETTLES
dialogues.text: SLAMS open the food truck’s REAR DOOR, kicks loose two PROPANE TANKS, sets them rolling -- Snaps a rifle to his shoulder, and as they bounce and tumble, FIRES--! DETONATES BOTH. They go up with a whooooosh--! Cascading flame... Debris, raining down --

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER, NOW
dialogues.text: Emerges from his COMMAND POST to a scene of chaos. SMOKE everywhere. Flame. He BARKS into his talkie:

dialogues.speaker: SECURE THE PAYLOAD
dialogues.text: IT! (to his Aide) Bring me the boy. Now. At which point, we abruptly (and oddly) CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS, (COULD BE ANYWHERE)
dialogues.text: A space. Cramped, disorienting -- where are we? Then, a familiar, TALON-LIKE HAND raises an equally famil device (THE KUJHAD). Commences tapping out a code --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAEGER’S AIDE appears at the hatch. Physically GRABS the GUARD posted to keep an eye on Rory: TRAEGER’S AIDE We’re taking ‘er up! Where’s the kid? They both scan the interior... shit. Where did he go? Not far. He steps out from the EQUIPMENT ALCOVE -- now wearing the Predator mask he found.  102. The mask’s tiny PLASMA-CASTER swivels, whrrrrrr--! A volley of energy BLOWS THE TWO MEN OUT THE OPEN HATCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory starts to go. TRIPS -- falls, drops the MASK, it bounces away -- he looks up, cocks his head: A HATCH OPENING behind him. A familiar, blood-chilling CLICKING SOUND, as...

dialogues.speaker: THE UPGRADED PREDATOR, NOW
dialogues.text: EMERGES, fetus-like from a FLOOR COMPARTMENT. He’s been concealed aboard the ship the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE NINE-FOOT PREDATOR RISES... towering. Ghastly. Rory scrambles to his feet. LEAPS out the hatchway -- EXT. “ARK” - CONTINUOUS -- hits the ground running. And screaming. And flailing. But at least he’s OUTSIDE. And that’s when

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND RISES UP
dialogues.text: In his path. Literally comes alive, like a CREATURE -- AS McKENNA STANDS Trailing dirt. The SOD from the trailer park GARDEN strap to his back. Face blackened. Eyes feral. He clutches his

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Easy, buddy. It’s me. Dad. Rory nods. McKenna looks up, STARTLED, as -- a FIGURE charges out of the smoke. It’s CASEY.

dialogues.speaker: AN OTHERWORLDLY HUMMING, NOW
dialogues.text: Suffuses the air... low. Ominous -- Uh-oh. They look toward the SHIP, as it commences to VIBRATE -- oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHIP
dialogues.text: HATCHES begin to open. All around the exterior. Metal doors SLIDING UPWARD -- dark inside. Beckoning. A CLATTER of assault rifles, SOLDIERS level their weapons THAT’S WHEN THE HYBRIDS EMERGE FROM THEIR PODS..!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWARMING. Some on four legs, some three. Some upright -- others SCUTTLING like crabs. So much smoke, so hard to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers BLINDLY OPEN FIRE--!

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: THE HYBRIDS CARVE A PATH THROUGH THE SOLDIERS--! Obscenel SHRIEKING as they’re pelted with bullets. Never stopping McKENNA AND CASEY Desperately casting around for a hiding place -- it’s RORY who grabs his Dad’s arm, POINTS:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What is it, son?

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: In there. The empty tubes. McKenna blinks. Brilliant. The VACATED CRYOTUBES, hatches wide open. He grabs Casey and the kid, bundles them insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SPOONS with Casey. Cradling his son, close. Hiding. Th bear hug he longed for? Now a survival tool. RORY cracks one eyelid, unable to not look:

dialogues.speaker: BRIEF, NIGHTMARE GLIMPSES
dialogues.text: Of the ship’s INTERSTELLAR PASSENGERS roaming the mist, killing. Each different, but all expressing a common trai The trademark mottled skull and mandibles of THE PREDATOR

dialogues.speaker: RORY SPOTS NETTLES
dialogues.text: The HERO LOONY, shepherding GIRLS into the taco truck. Swinging up into the DRIVER’S SEAT, except... Something between TUSK AND TALON comes through the windshield. Rory SHUTS HIS EYES; bye-bye, Nettles.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MAIN HATCH
dialogues.text: Here he comes. Golem-like. Looming. Stalking majestically from the main hatchway as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Converge on him. GATHERING. Circling their leader in ragg formation -- almost a MILITARY greeting. An unspoken orde from the UPGRADE -- and with that, off they go, loping aw Vanishing into the surrounding trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKENNA turns to Rory:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Are you... are you okay? Mckenna frowns. No answer. Rory’s not looking at him. He’s looking UP. Petrified... because they’re not alone. Something’s in here with them. McKenna follows his gaze. A low animal CHITTERING, all too familiar... above them, hanging UPSIDE DOWN: not a holographic projection, but the real deal -- A SPIDER/PREDATOR HYBRID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all SCRAMBLE OUT. SPIN back around, panicked, as THE HYBRID APPEARS. Poised in the hatch, mandibles extended. As McKenna watch -- Rory taps the code, the hatch SLAMS SHUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the front half? Still alive, STILL MOVING -- CASEY AND MCKENNA BLAST IT TO TATTERS. As the thing finally, blessedly expires:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) (gasping) I hate spiders. If... if it happens again --

dialogues.speaker: RORY AND MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (nod, in unison:) Let’s call Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aftermath. A HAZE of smoke and debris hangs over the vacated ARK. Medics tend to the wounded.  105. McKENNA limps into view. Bee-lines to Traeger. Livid.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: It was in there the whole time, you asshole. That was its goddamn PLAN!

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: Fool me twice, shame on me.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Where was it going? WHERE DID HE

dialogues.speaker: TRAEGER
dialogues.text: That’s classified, Lieutenant. Before McKenna can respond with action, Traeger DRAWS HIS SIDEARM ON HIM; a twinkle in his eye. TRAEGER (CONT’ D) Kind of ironic, really. A trained sniper, dying from a headshot. BLAMM--! McKenna flinches as -- BLOOD spatters his face. A thousand-meter-a-second SNIPER ROUND just pierced TRAEGER’S HEAD. The guy drops, lifeless. SHIT. McKENNA spins, eyes tracking downrange -- Predator weapon--? Nope. M24 sniper rifle. GENERAL WOODHURST, comes into view, flanked by ARMY troop

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Good riddance to bad rubbish. (NOTE: This is the General we saw on the phone with Traeg earlier.) He stops just shy of McKenna. Nods tersely: WOODHURST (CONT’D) Breathe easy, soldier. I’m on your side. CASEY, RORY and THE LOONIES step forward to join McKenna. Woodhurst regards them. Points to Rory, Casey, and Cutter

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) You stay here. (looks up) The rest of you, come with me.  106. Casey puts a maternal hand on Rory’s shoulder. A reassuring look to McKenna: “I’1l take care of him.”

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: A Cape Canaveral-like launch facility abuts what looks like an animal habitat. Vast swampland beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodhurst rides shotgun. McKenna and The Loonies in back, looking down at the facility below.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What am I looking at? Stargazer HQ?

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Stargazer was all Traeger. CIA black ops, corporate donors, all that shit. Wasn’t us. Off McKenna, stupefied: WOODHURST (CONT’D) Oh, yeah. Son of a whore went off the reservation. He was in it for profit. Practically stole that Predator for his little science experiments. He’s also the one who framed you. (beat) It’s not like I shot him just ‘cause I felt like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY can’t help but eye THE SPACECRAFT curiously. Her army CHAPERONES, momentarily distracted; RORY nudges her, mischievous:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Wanna see what’s inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLAST of SOUND AND WIND as the TWO LAKOTA HELICOPTERS LAND inside chain link and razor wire marked with signs:  107.

dialogues.speaker: NO TRESPASSING
dialogues.text: Dust swirls as McKenna and the men jump out -- trade glan It isn’t just the SOLDIERS MOBILIZING, or even the 40mm a aircraft guns... It’s the urgency. Like they’re preparing a siege. Woodhurst leads them down some steps to

dialogues.speaker: A MODERNISTIC BUNKER
dialogues.text: Half-in/half-out of the ground. GREEN BERETS at the entra

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: We don’t have time for security checks, just behave yourselves and we won’t have to shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: “Area 52.” Base of operations.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Defending earth from the Predators. The doors YAWN OPEN, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woodhurst leads the men down a long corridor lined with DISPLAY CASES: Predator SKELETONS; WEAPONS; BATTLE ARMOR. WOODHURST (CONT’D) They’ ve been coming here for years. Problem is, their m.o.’s changing. Dissension among the ranks. You saw it yourself -- that big one tore the other one in half. They reach a security checkpoint. Walk right through. WOODHURST (CONT’D) Luckily, we have some... “consultants” helping us. (a hard look Hope you boys are wearing your Depends... Hydraulic DOORS SLIDE OPEN TO REVEAL:  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you’d see at the zoo. But no lions, no tigers, no bears. Instead? Behind thick Plexi: TWO PREDATORS turn to look at our heroes. Same size as our “good” Predator. They blink curiously. WOODHURST (CONT’D) There’s a cold war going on, gentlemen. Seems it’s heating up. (re: Predators) These two... are defectors. Been here almost a year. McKenna, at a loss. No words. Finally manages:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: They’re okay with... with being cooped up in there?

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Oh, we let ‘em out at night. Game preserve, next door. They’re peace emmissaries but... hell, they’re still Predators, they’re gonna kill shit. He lights a cigar: WOODHURST (CONT’D) That first one you met? “Tiny?” (points to defectors) He was on their side. Stole the ark with those hybrids so the big fuck couldn’t use ‘em against us.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: Whoa. You’re saying the first alien was... friendly?

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Fuck that. The son of a bitch killed my men.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Hey, I never said he was a nice guy... just that he was on our side. Which brings us to the Big Bad -- (beat) Who, unless I miss my guess, is on his way here right now. With his “team.”  109.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: But why? What’s his end game? Woodhurst shrugs:

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Like I said. Cold war. (re: Predators) He came to kill these two. McKenna takes a moment. Looks up --

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: So, he’s... an assassin?

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: That’s right, Lieutenant. That thing out there’s an assassin. (icy glance) Just like you.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Say you’re right. It takes out its targets, then what? Without warning, ONE OF THE PREDATORS “talks”; its peculi throaty RATTLE of CLICKS over a scratchy P.A. speaker. An AIDE hands Woodhurst a device with a small LED screen. He keys it like a walkie-talkie, says:

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Please repeat that. The Predator repeats with more emphasis. Woodhurst looks

dialogues.speaker: THE LED SCREEN
dialogues.text: A brief delay, we see: Searching... Searching... finally, a DIGITIZED VOICE issues from the device:

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR VOICE
dialogues.text: “Protocol 3. The synthetic will identify and procure most evolved opponent.” The words hang in the air a moment.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: That’s the thing, see -- it won’t just leave. Not without souvenirs. (beat) It’s going to choose the strongest, most worthy adversary, and --  110.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (finishing the thought) -- and rips out its spine for the DNA, to take back home. (turns to Predator) Is that about the size of it..? The Predator SPEAKS AGAIN. Woodhurst looks at THE TRANSLA Searching... Searching... Searching...

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: VOICE “About size.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SENTRY PATROLS. Stops, and squints at: A four-legged ANIMAL, in silhouette. A coyote..? Now, ANOTHER ANIMAL joins the first: no legs here at all. Tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: Mudbug One, we got BAMFs at the outside wire, WE GOT BAMFS AT TH-- WHOMP--!! ONE OF THE CREATURES TAKES HIM DOWN, DRAGS HIM. Nothing left after ten yards but slicks of blood and sine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring the exterior: THE HYBRIDS, cutting through the perimeter sentries. Alarms start to WAIL, as

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Looks on, McKenna and the others bathed in the ice-blue glow of the monitors. The General licks his lips, says:

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Get ‘em outta here.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Who? Woodhurst points at the Predators in the enclosure.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: Them. We’1l hold off the others ‘til you get away.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Away WHERE--?  111.

dialogues.speaker: WOODHURST
dialogues.text: The SHIP, for Chrissakes. If you get them to the ship, they know how to fly it. His tone softens. Respectful. WOODHURST (CONT’D) Look, we’ve been watching you. You’re good at this. (beat) Just get ‘em to their ride. We’1l handle the bugs. McKenna and team don’t ask questions. They MOBILIZE. As Woodhurst calls after them: WOODHURST (CONT’D) I’m scrambling F-22'’s. Contact them once you’re in the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights FLICKER on and off, suggesting the Predators have attacked the central power system. Our heroes -- as well as the PREDATOR DEFECTORS -- GRAB WEAPONS from the display cases. McKenna stuffs them in a backpack: a Shuriken, a combistick, a biohelmet. He puts on the mask, looks at Williams.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (muffled) I feel like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: You look like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VEHICLES come blasting up out of a tunnel, exiting the compound. A HIGH SPEED CONVOY, on the move. ARMY MOTORCYCLES. Behind them: JEEPS -- with pedestal- mounted machine guns. Imagine the Presidential motorcade but bristling with artillery. And IN THE CENTER of the convoy, the key vehic -- the one WILLIAMS is driving: AN M113 STRYKER ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIER. McKenna, Baxley and Coyle are on top as well as, yes --  112.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO PREDATORS
dialogues.text: Each armed with an M60 machine gun in one hand, a plasma- caster in the other. Ready to fight alongside our heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, a continuous ROAR of gunfire -- the army ver the HYBRIDS, off-screen. Now, however, it becomes sporadi And then, rather suddenly, ceases altogether. WILLIAMS (CONT’D) Guess they took care of the bugs? One of the PREDATOR DEFECTORS utters some guttural CLICKS Williams consults the translator: Searching... Searching.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: VOICE “Fornicate.”

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA, UP TOP
dialogues.text: looks toward the rear of the gauntlet. They’ve got compan

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Incoming!

dialogues.speaker: THE HYBRIDS
dialogues.text: SCRAMBLE into view at high speed, picking up the scientis scent. Drooling mandibles, flashing eyes... Nightmare tim

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST HYBRID LEAPS
dialogues.text: ONTO the rear support jeep. Fanged. Clinging. A SOLDIER

dialogues.speaker: RAKES IT WITH ARTILLERY-- BRRAAAPPPP--
dialogues.text: The jeep JACK-KNIFES. The HYBRID leaps to the ground, THE GUNNER’S SKIN IN ITS MOUTH -- !

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE HYBRIDS
dialogues.text: SCURRY behind the APC like racing dogs. THE LOONIES AND THE PREDATORS unload on them, but one manages to LEAP onto the back! Teeth gnashing. It FALLS OFF, but quickly regroups -- HURTLES back, but -- BRAKK! BRAKK! Surgical bullet hits. The thing BUCKLES. Plumes of GREEN BLOOD, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hangs off the back of the APC with a SNIPER RIFLE, taking well-placed shots. Beside him:

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: Look at their necks, Chief! McKenna blinks. “What??”

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: THEIR NECKS
dialogues.text: McKenna squints at:

dialogues.speaker: THE HYBRIDS, IN PURSUIT
dialogues.text: And there, sure enough, something resembling COLLARS. McKenna raises the TRANSLATOR PAD; YELLS to the nearest Predator scientist:

dialogues.speaker: WHAT ARE THOSE COLLARS
dialogues.text: The Predator BARKS and TRILLS between blasts. CLOSE ON TRANSLATOR: Searching... Searching...

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR VOICE
dialogues.text: “Self. Destruct.” McKenna, intense. Thinking quickly, he grabs the talkie from his belt, turns it on:

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (into Bluetooth) Casey, it’s McKenna! Are you there? Do you have access to the ship?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey and Rory, INSIDE THE SHIP.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (into Bluetooth; sheepish) Um..? She makes a face at Rory; “BUS-TED.”

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Listen to me! The hybrids have some kind of self-destruct collars! Is there a way to --  114. Rory overhears this; GRABS Casey’s talkie, excited:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Dad, it’s me, I saw it! I saw the the program! The first Predator was trying to blow them up, but the sequence stopped.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Can you do it?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: There was something about self- destruct in the file. The one Schaefer met in ‘87 left a pretty big hole.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: These only have a ten-foot radius. We’re cool. Sort of. Casey turns, incredulous. Rory squirms, self-conscious:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: (CONT’D) Maybe twenty. (beat) I, uh, saw it in the helmet. Suddenly paranoid, Casey YANKS THE SNIFFER’S COLLAR OFF - - HURLS IT out the open hatch. The Sniffer CHASES AFTER IT, playing fetch again. Casey WHIRLS -- sees RORY’S FINGERS, already tapping a CONTROL PANEL. She can’t fight the urge to smile.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: He’s on it, McKenna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKenna watches the hybrids darting after them.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: (into Bluetooth; tense) I have visual. Any time now would be great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rory hits keys, sweating. MCKENNA (CONT’ D) Rory--?  115.

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: I know, I get it. I’m TRYING! CASEY looks around, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Too far. We must be out of range. (wit’s end) If only there was a way to MOVE this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARTING and WEAVING. Seemingly fixated on a single object

dialogues.speaker: THE ARMORED PERSONNEL CARRIER
dialogues.text: MCKENNA sees this, keys the translation device:

dialogues.speaker: VEHICLES--
dialogues.text: The Predator near him speaks: KLIK-RATTLE-KLIK! On the device: Searching... Searching...

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: VOICE “We are target.” OFF McKenna, the color draining from his face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE APC careens into view. HYBRIDS close on its heels.

dialogues.speaker: BAXLEY EATS IT
dialogues.text: as, from nowhere, a hybrid LEAPS -- TEARS HIS SKIN OFF. T body tumbles away... COYLE, next in line. He doesn’t go quietly. UNLOADS a volley of ammo in the creature’s FACE -- THE HYBRID CHEWS HIS SPINE OUT before it COLLAPSES, dead weight pressing down on Coyle’s ravaged corpse.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS, DRIVING
dialogues.text: For the first time, he looks nervous. Glances down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing the SPACE SHIP’S location. A quick glance tells us they are still a mile out.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: (into Bluetooth) Hey, Lieutenant, you got a plan, or..?

dialogues.speaker: ON MCKENNA
dialogues.text: And his face pretty much tells the tale: nope. Then he sp something new. In the distance behind them, but growing..

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR, THE BIG BAD
dialogues.text: SPRINTING like a cheetah, in pursuit. CLOSING FAST. He sports TWO WRIST GAUNTLETS -- projectile arrows and CANNON. That’s it. Lean and mean.

dialogues.speaker: MCKENNA
dialogues.text: Carnage, all around. He looks at the Predator defectors; SCREAMS into the translation device:

dialogues.speaker: HOW DO WE WIN--
dialogues.text: BLEAT OF CLICKS from the Predator. Searching... Searching

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: VOICE “Maybe not win.”

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: looks at the GPS display. Frowns. SEES the ship-blip is n MOVING TOWARD THEM.... WTF? Which is when:

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE SHADOW
dialogues.text: falls over road. Blotting out the moon. Is it..? It is. THE ARK -- and it’s fucking AIRBORNE--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwarfed by the massive “Captain’s chair”, RORY is now wea the Predator biohelmet, psychically linked to the technol He works the controls, spins to CASEY:

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: Taking her down... NOW.  117. Determined, he GRABS the control yoke. Just one problem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landing this fucker ain’t easy. Plus it’s damaged, remember? The spacecraft BUCKS. WOBBLES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY, flung sideways. Goes sliding --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Are you trying to crash?? I thought you were some kind of genius, for chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: RORY
dialogues.text: I’M IN SPECIAL CLASS, OKAY? A sudden LURCH. The DESTRUCT console JERKS in her hands, and she blinks, registering: it moves. New idea. She GRABS THE CONTROL PANEL, hauls it loose -- and PROPEL it across the deck toward: AN ESCAPE POD.
